text: Everything was awesome. Olivios grill closed and  this is for sure my new Greek joint. Taziki was perfect. Yellow rice was full of flavor. My roommate had extra gyro meat and he said it it was almost TOO MUCH, but it was so good he ate every bite

Absolutely love this place.  I ended up at this restaurant as my desire for Greek food was not satisfied at nearby locations.   The staff here are excellent.  Very friendly and very helpful if you have any questions with food options.  The restaurant is very clean and the food is very fresh.  I had the "Greek Night Club" Gyro and it was delicious.  You are given the option of sides ranging from fries to salad.  Value-wise I would say that it is excellent as I thought that the price was fair for the freshness of the food and I didn't leave hungry.
Best gyros in town, but Cynthia is the real reason we come here. Been here over 25 times and she always remembers our usual order is pleasant and efficient  Cynthia is the face of Mikas Greek.
Usually go to the Scottsdale location but was in the area of the new location. The restaurant was very clean, the service was great and the food was very good!
This place has great food!!  I love their fresh salads with grilled chicken and their gyros are the best!!!
Pretty good.  Nice job with interior finishes, service very friendly.  Good value and good food

So I've been out biking all afternoon and it's still a gorgeous day so I want to sit outside somewhere and eat something. I stop at this little Gyros shop in an obscure corner of Papago Plaza for the sole reason that it has a great outdoor seating spot -wide, well shaded, far enough from the street and a decent view over Skysong with a bit of the Supes peaking through.  And the food is fantastic!! I had the chicken Pita, which was astoundingly tasty, with a great salad and it's $6.25? How is that possible? And the service (I think that was George?) couldn't have been better. And the place inside is clean and bright.   Nobody could ask for more.

Gross, mass-produced approximation of greek "style" food. Falafel was clearly from a frozen bag and pita was also clearly store bought, not home made. I have to admit the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Food and service was amazing. Food is prepared to order! Was a little hesitant because the location is in a small shopping plaza but turned out to be fantastic. The Decor was really modern and nice! Me and my wife both had gyro's which were great! Love Greek food!

My new favorite place for gyros!! Large portions, choice of fries, salad or soup with with gyro for under $8.00. Everything was fresh and clean. Service was friendly and quick. Will definitely be back!!!
My go-to Greek joint. I recommend the original gyro or the jalapeño hummus with chicken. Very friendly staff....this place is SUH GUUUD
Its pretty good place. Last time the service wasnt the best, but anyways, the food is Ok .Lentil SOUP is great.

First time there today for lunch and I am definitely a fan now.  The salad is excellent, the chicken moist and tender.  The hummus and pita starter is delicious too!    I will definitely be going back.
I had the chicken and vegetable skewer, both were excellent and cooked to perfection.  The staff is very friendly and the service was excellent.  I would definitely go back!

First time here and will definitely be back! I had the original Picato and it was FANTASTIC!!!! The place was very clean and the staff was well versed on the menu and very friendly and helpful! Can't wait to come back and try something else!!
It's college move-in weekend so we're new to the area. The pita sandwiches were delicious, and we really loved the unique village salad.

Oohhh, I usually order a Greek Night Club pita with chicken, but upon feeling indecisive and learning that Mika's has online ordering...one of the meat choices listed was 1/2 chicken 1/2 gyro. Um, yes please! They had all sorts of options that you can customize with a simple click of a button (white or wheat pita? no onions? extra sauce? cut in half? etc. Boom! Done.) It even gave me a pick-up time and I received text notifications when my order was in-process and ready for pick-up. Having already paid online, I just walked in, was handed my bag, and went on my way. The whole process was very simple, convenient, and fast! Plus, I didn't have to mispronounce gyro over the phone. Hahaha. Score!   My pita was excellent ~ stuffed full of gyro, chicken, lettuce, tomato, onions, kalamata olives, tzatziki, and feta! Mmm! It was a little on the salty side, which I actually like, but just something to consider if you're sensitive to that sort of thing. The side greek salad was also very good. One of these days I'll get around to trying the lentil soup...  All in all, you can get a great, fast, filling meal here for less than $10, that you feel about eating. WIN.

I love Mika's.  My girlfriend and I often find ourselves wandering in once a week when we do not feel like cooking but dont want to eat garbage food out. In a society where we constantly have disgusting fake food pushed in our face it is nice to know there are still options out there that serve REAL food.  The service is phenomenal.  The ladies behind the counter are always very nice, even when we stroll in at 8:30pm and they close at 9pm (I'd be grumpy).  We usually dine in and the food is brought out to us in a very timely manner, usually still piping hot.  The food.  Every time I go I get the chicken picado with basmati rice. Every single time I get a tingly feeling in my loins after I eat it.  When I am balling out, I get extra chicken (more on this later).  I put some siracha on the rice and go to work.    I would probably eat here everyday if could and never get tired of it.  The ONE downfall.  Pricing.  It is decently priced for a standard meal ($7-$9).  However, if you like to spice it up and get extras you can really run up the tab.  Extra meat is $2.95 and extra veggies etc is $0.95.  Dont matter doe Ill still go back.
Best gyro ever! We drive out of our way to come eat here and we've never been disappointed! Always good portions, fresh, and clean.

Saw the reviews, everything looked great so my boyfriend and I each got a platter with fries and rice. His was the gyro platter and mine the chicken souvlaki.  Being from the middle east, I have high standards for hummus and other Mediterranean food. While the fries and rice were good, the hummus, tzatziki, and chicken all had a too-lemony flavor which definitely is not how those foods should taste.  To mange things infinitely worse, in the middle of the night I wake up to my first symptom of food poisoning, by early morning I'm in the er with an iv.  Eight hours later I was discharged, but an still recuperating.   While my boyfriend didn't get sick, do you really want to run a 50/50 chance of food poisoning?   Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.

Place is clean and nice. I wanna give it more stars because the food is not bad (not great tho) but the price just doesn't add up for what they give you. 2 pita sandwiches probably should cost $20. Chicken salad probably should be $12. Also I hate being nickel and dime'd for small stuff like 75 cents to add tomatoes. Plenty of other gyro spots that are just as good for cheaper.

One word. PATHETIC.  I have ordered out from Mika's five times. None of those experiences were impressive. The last time, about 3 weeks ago, was the worst.  The woman who took my order over the phone could not get it right. She spoke English fluently, but kept repeating the wrong order. I finally spelled it out for her.    After I picked up my order and got it home, I found that my HOT grilled Greek Chicken was packed in the same container as my COLD Greek Salad. Needless to say the salad was wilted and inedible. Plus they put in ONE Kalamata Olive. ONE!  The feta cheese was miniscule; and the salad greens were wilted & soggy. Only good item was the chicken, after I reheated it. My wife ordered Chicken SOUVLAKI with Rice. That was ok.  But we also ordered from the Kid's Menu: Grilled Greek Chicken with Fries.  ( Yeah, I know. A "Greek" restaurant that serves French Fries.)  It would have been acceptable if the fries were cooked correctly. But these potato strips were beyond pathetic. Cold, soaked in old smelly deep fry oil that probably hadn't been changed in a year. They resembled sponges. If you twisted them, oil would pour out. Of course the chicken was packed in the same container as the pathetic fries, so it all stunk from old dirty deep fry oil.  I was going to throw it out along with my wilted salad, but then decided to offer the chicken & frys to my dog.  He took one whiff of them and walked away hungry.  Here's what I witnessed another time at Mika's Greek: I drove over there and ordered takeout. Greek Grilled Chicken and Dolmathes.  I sat in their "dining room" at a high stool & table. I watched the "chef" in the open kitchen.  It was then that I saw that he did not wash is hands after handling raw chicken. He would take the poultry out of a container and toss it on the hot grill with bare hands . Then he would wipe his contaminated hands on a side towel. Then use the same side towel to wipe up the work station.   At that point the chef noticed me watching him. He realized he committed health code violations. But he STILL didn't correct them. Now he put on foodsafe gloves while handling raw chicken, but then only rinsed his gloved hands off with cold water, wiped hands on the previously salmonella soiled side towel, and proceeded to make the raw cold vegetable Greek salad.   When I got the food home I put the hot food into my warming oven for 2 hours at 200°F. That would kill the bacteria that "chef" had given me.  Chicken was ok, albeit dry, but at least I knew I wouldn't spend the night in the ER with food borne illness. One last note. Remember the Dolmathes that I mentioned earlier? In case you don't know, these are grape leaves stuffed with rice. When I bit into mine, there was no rice. Mika's Greek stuffed MY Dolmathes with...you ready......?.....Mashed up soggy french fried potatoes.  I kid you not.  So my grade for Mika's Greek in PHX is.....an "F".
The Gyro was incredible. The original hummus was bland but that wont stop me from coming back!

Yum! I love the spicy gyro...can't remember it's name, but it was really good. They give you a lot of meat. I mean, really a lot of meat...which is what I like. If you order your food to go, they put it in a nice aluminim-kind of thingie which keeps your food hot. My drive was about 30 min before I got home and my gyro was still hot. The fries was gone by the time I got to the freeway though...it was delish!

First time I have been here, like others I was impressed by the cleanliness and modern feel of the building. What really stood out though was the food. I had the Greekpeno pita with the beef souvlaki which was wonderfully spiced. The Greek fries we're also amazing with the dressing and feta generous put on top of the fries. I thought the peppers would overpower the dish but it all mingled very well together. Service was great and the employees were nice.  Will definitely be back again!
Very delicious. Lentil soup was fantastic and the Caesar gyro was excellent. Prepared quickly and the portions were large. A bit on the pricey end, but still somewhere I'll return to.
So good!! Got the mediterranean pita with jalapeno hummus.. so so delish! Definitely coming back!!

Stopped in for a light lunch last Saturday and ordered the village salad with gyro meat. I was surprised at how clean the place was and had high expectations. When I received my Village salad it was nothing more than a $0.79 can of garbanzo beans with a sprinkling of tomatoes cucumbers and red onion there was no feta and the dressing was pathetic. It was more like hospital food. When I asked the manager on duty to please fix it they she argued with me so I asked for my money back and got more attitude.   If you're going to serve something and charge $8 for it at least make it edible and worth $8 I won't be back I was very disappointed. Had they given me my money back promptly  or fixed the salad they would have gotten a 3 to 4 star rating.  I understand sometimes things go wrong but that wasn't the case here.  I'm still wondering how they have such a high rating?
Delicious! The jalapeño hummus is really good and loved the spicy chicken skewers - flavorful and tender

What a wonderful surprise! We were searching for a quick bite to eat but l usually don't enjoy fast food joints. This sounded different and well worth a try. We decided to have the "Greek Sampler," which had 3 Falafel, 3 dolmades, tzatziki, generous serving of homemade hummus with 8 warm pita quarters. Every item was fresh and savory.  "Mika's Fries" seriously the Best! Fries tossed with there Greek house dressing, topped with feta, tzatziki and gyro. Yummy!  The staff was super friendly and the restaurant is clean, new and nicely decorated. The only thing missing is some music
This place is so good and fresh and everyone there is so nice! I've never been so satisfied by a Greek restaurant until now. And it was incredibly clean. Kudos~
You like Greek? You gotta give Mika's a try! Pitas and platters that are delicious and affordable. Try their souvlaki or geek wings

Came to this location and restaurant for the first time yesterday 6/19/17. The salads were huge portions and the chicken was great. I went to the Elliot location today 6/20, because we had such a great experience at Mill Ave. It was night and day difference. Chicken sucked at Elliot and portions were half the size...

I ordered the Greek Salad. It was good, but I had this yesterday at the Mill Ave location and it was twice the size. I'll keep going to Mill Ave location instead. $18 for 2 Greek Salads one with chicken and one without. I feel ripped off and the chicken sucked.
Awesome Greek food! So happy to have found this spot, the ingredients they used were fresh and the food was delicious!

Don't be deceived by its strip mall location, this place is legit!! Great gyro meat, lamb kabobs-like, greek fries, salad and lentil soup! All very reasonably pricedand we had leftovers. Place and bathrooms super clean.
Very good Gyro and Salad.  Hummus was a little salty, but had great flavor.  I would recommend this place!
I've been looking for a place to have a pitas. This place is great!  The food is wonderful. The service is awesome and it's impeccably clean.

Nice place. Very modern and clean. Everyone seems very friendly. Prices are reasonable. I wouldn't say I ever crave their food, but it's basic Mediterranean selection. Never had anything bad here though. Been here multiple times and I will keep returning. Like it better than the other Greek/Mediterranean restaurants in the neighborhood. They're fairly quick too. Good gyros and Greek salad!
This place is fantastic! Scottsdale needed a good, fresh Greek place that wasn't run by a bunch of dodgy characters. Love the atmosphere but nothing tops the food. Healthy, fresh & delicious!

So, I had The Gyro & Fries. It was pretty good I had Better But there's a lot worst out there too. The atmosphere is real nice real clean, Its only been open 4 days so I hope It stays that way. Nice and Friendly staff. The only thing I would say I wasn't a fan of and to be honest it's not that big of a deal. I prefer white onions on my Gyro not Red but it's still was good. I'll Go Back For Sure
This place is amazing!! I come here for lunch a few times a week with my coworkers. Their pitas are fantastic!  The Greek chicken is some of the best in town and their greek fries!!

Definitely a fan of both the food and location.  So happy to have a little Greek food in the heart of mid-town Phoenix.   It's conveniently located across the street from St. Joseph's hospital 1/4 mile from Central Ave.  My husband and I started with the falafel appetizer.  In my opinion, they make the one of the best falafel's I've ever tasted!  Crispy and spicy!    I also ordered the cucumber salad - very refreshing (although I would ask for the sauce on the side next time).  We order Gyros for lunch - the meat was great and the serving is generous.   Oh, and I ordered the Greek fries served with lemon/garlic sauce -- yum, yum.  My only critique is that I prefer my Tziki a little more garlic and thicker than how they serve it at Mika's.  It's set up more like a fast food joint, but everything is made fresh there on the premises and the inside is very nice, but small.   Give it a try if you are in Central Phoenix at an event at the Heard, or an exhibit at the Phoenix Art Museum.  And, lucky you if you work downtown :)
We were doing some business nearby and needed a quick bite to eat. Took a chance on this place and it was great. Good food, quick service, clean restaurant and very reasonable prices.

Very good and freshly prepared "quick food" Greek/Med food, clean modern space with nice seating. I just moved into the neighborhood and was delighted to find Mika's...and find is the key word.  It is located in the Papago Plaza strip mall ( abit of 1950's Pueblo Kitsch) and like pretty much all the businesses there has no road signage.  It is on the southwestern side of the mall on the Scottsdale Road side.  Worth looking for!

Stopped in for a quick bit and I was wrong about quick. I waited in line for 10 mins my mistake for going during the lunch rush.  I ordered the jalapeño hummus which I felt was really dry, my gyro was good just like any other place I felt and my Greek fries tastes normal. Nothing really stood out for me.  It's a real normal place just like any other chain

Great greek food with fast and high quality service. Everything I tried was delicious! The food is reasonably priced, and they have a good history of getting all of our office orders right, which is a rarity nowadays it seems!

Sometimes I wish I didn't know about this place because now I am obsessed with their Grilled Chicken Pita. It's just absolutely delicious! It's got to be the tzatziki sauce that makes the pita even more flavorful. If you are craving Greek food and looking for something new, you should check this place out! And be sure to come in hungry because they really stuff the pita with meat!

First timers and this place is soooo good! I always like a place that doesn't mind you to watch them prepare/cook your food. It is open, inviting, and clean. The staff is wonderful! So friendly and willing to help. I saw the gentleman guiding a confused couple through the menu. He was gracious and patient with them. The food was prompt but fresh and delicous. The meat was spiced to perfection and the mika greek fries were delicous as well. The menu is adventurous for a Greek place, which was refreshing. Some very traditional mixed in with a touch of modern flavors. We had the diablo pita which had Sriracha and fresh chopped veggies, see? Different. The portions were generous. They didn't hold back at all! Will definitely be returning and would recommend to anyone.
First time going today and I  really enjoy it the food was really good better then my expectation.  I was debating in going because normally don't end up not liking a new place.

Fantastic!!!!!  Grilled chicken pitta and gyro picante ordered with salads absolutely great loads of flavor great portion size and great value. Defiantly become a regular haunt. Staff were so helpful and happy great to chat with while waiting for the awesome food
Rock-solid new design. The Chipotle of gyros in Scottsdale. Highly recommend the Picado!

We tried this spot out tonight for the first time and we will definitely be back. The food was outstanding! Ordered a chicken pita and gyro pita. Both were filled with lots of meat and the hummus and tzatziki sauce were wonderful.

Saw this place pop up on nearby restaurants because I live in the area and I have been looking for new places. I enjoy gyros and was skeptical until the food came out. The lentil soup was amazing but meat was outstanding. Best gyro meat I have had in the valley. Will be returning again and may become a very frequent take out spot for me. Creative pitas and flavors too so I can't wait to try more.

Hi.  I was super excited to try Mika's as my coworkers had raved about it.  It is within walking distance to our building, so super easy to get to!  I did an online order for a falafel pita and loved the ease of ordering and text status updates.  I was disappointed, however, that I was told at the counter that the falafel contains egg, even though it doesn't list that as an ingredient online.  I asked the person to confirm and she was certain that it did.  I've been vegan for 10+ years and eat at Pita Jungle and Tzikii (which are both down the street) at least once a week and have no issues finding tons of options (including falafel without egg) at those locations and Mediterranean places nationwide.  Any chance you will be changing the recipe soon?  If not, we'll need to leave it off the list.

Absolutely the worst pita I've ever had. I ordered a vegetable pita and it showed up and it was just filled with nasty tomatoes that were so soggy they drenched the bread to the point of mush. I could not eat this. It was dripping and the bread was like it was soaked in liquid. So grosssssss. My salad was good. But my son was eating his and started yelling and spit it out. Claimed it tasted like hand sanitizer. Mind you he loves Greek salads and vinager and he ate 75% of it before he had the rancid bite. The cucumbers that came with the hummus we're soggy. My bf enjoyed his gyro pita though. I spent forty five dollars to be completely disgusted with my dinner. The delivery fee was $7.00 which is a lot in my opinion. Won't ever order from here again.

Favorite spot for *fast* Greek food! I've been a customer since they first opened- staff is always very helpful and friendly, owners remember you and are always sincerely grateful for your business. Food always comes out fast, and they are great at accommodating any requests when/if they are able to. I've had nearly everything on the menu at this point, and everything is always fresh, fast and flavorful in the true Greek tradition. Decor is very modern and clean with a nice nod to the beauty of Greece in the artwork- and the restaurant's always very, very clean. Favorite menu items are their baklava and the lentil soup- delicious!! This place is a great addition to the line up in the local area.

I was super excited to try this place out because who doesn't like a little OPA! in their life? I must say this place is killer. Clean and modern inside, helpful staff, and great Greek food.   I had the Grilled Greek Chicken platter and my Fiance had the Gyro platter. We both split the Hummus sampler. The gyro meat was moist and flavorful, grilled chicken with cooked to perfection with just enough spice to know it's "Greek Chicken", and the Hummus and Tzatziki were just out of this world!   Overall it was a good experience, will definitely be back!

Great for kids -- and their grandparents.  Took all three grandchildren and all of us were happy with our meals.  Kids portions actually seem adult sized.  We were kinda like the Three Bears -- one had the chicken wings, 2nd had the grilled chicken, and the 3rd had the gyro.  Kids got right down to business and we could tell they were very happy with their dinner.   I was truly amazed at the amount of gyro meat for a child!  One grand-daughter sampled the rice that came with my delicious falafel platter, then asked for more -- wondered what gives it the yellow color.  Plenty of FRESH pita comes with all the plates.  This was our third time (husband and I) to come to Mika's, and all three times we've been very impressed: very clean, bright, roomy, friendly service, healthy and savory food.  First visit was with a DealChicken(I think--maybe it was a Groupon), so I'm hoping Mika's was well rewarded with that venture.  AND, daughter-in-law stopped in to retrieve her two daughters, decided to order, savored --  said Mika's will be on her restaurant rotation, too.  Opa!  My five stars-- for a quick meal, can't be beat.  Not for a date night aimed to impress, be aware.

Never had a bad visit here. This is the hidden gem of Scottsdale! Fresh food, friendly customer service, and no wait! If I had to pick one thing that stood out to me, it would have to be the cleanliness. Cleanest restaurant I've ever been to. Definitely recommend Mika's to all my friends!

This place was great! For the prices, they really give you a good portion of well-cooked food. The Diablo gyro pita is delicious. Their Mika fries are delicious. The souvlaki has a really good flavor to it. You'd be hard pressed to find a Greek restaurant that'll have as good of food for the price. It's the same prices pretty much as pita jungle, but better food. The ambiance is modern and goes well. Service was good and the place is clean. I will definitely come back here again.

Ordered chicken wrap with salad for side. Ordered online and picked up at store. Was very convenient.   Pita wrap was pretty good. Fresh ingredients. Good taste. Got ALOT of chicken in the wrap so I put it on my salad.    I will come back for lunch at some point since it's nearby my work place.  But wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. Pretty good overall. Met my craving for Greek. Wouldn't say it's authentic but the meat and veggies are fresh! And the prices are very reasonable!
Clean. Modern. Delicious. The Greek fries are soooo good and topped with TONS of feta. The Chicken Soulvaki is cooked perfectly. Service is prompt and prices are reasonable. Closed Sundays.
We ordered gyros and a Greek sampler.  Everything was good and tasted fresh.  It's clear that their food is made in house.  I will definitely be going back.

I live within a mile of this place and had been wishing for a good Greek restaurant to open up (plenty of not so good ones are already open).  Got my wish with this place.  The food is excellent, especially the chicken.  I really like that the owner, Don, is always in there working and taking pride in what he does.  Very friendly service, very modern and clean restaurant.  I eat here at least once a week. - never disappointed.  They are also very good and fast with call in orders.
Food was very good, tried the gyro picado '& a pleasant spice to the meat.

Fast and Fresh Greek Fare in Phoenix.  Me and my coworker stopped in to try the new location in Phoenix.   I ordered the Gyro Pita, which was filled with a tender and flavorful beef & lamb mixture with a good spice mixture that enhanced the meat without being overpowering, which is a common problem at greek places.  The pita was fresh and warm and filled with a good amount of meat, and not buried under a lot of lettuce and other "fillers." French fries were fresh, hot and crisp.  All the ingredients were very fresh tasting and lacked the "reheated" fare you get at other places. Although I would have preferred a bit more tzatziki sauce, it was still one of the best Gyros I have had around downtown Phoenix in a long time.  My coworker, a vegetarian, had the falafel and found them very flavorful and light, and had similar comments about the fresh taste of his lunch.  We will be adding this place to our normal lunch rotation.

Loved it!  I honestly did not expect much when coming to this restaurant. But, it's got an awesome little vibe  to it, great prices, and good food.  The front hostess/cashier, Amy, was super friendly and totally cool! She was very helpful with getting my order exactly right , which really meant a lot!   I gave it 5 stars because of the food quality compared to the low price and because of the Amy at the front....

Meh. Don't understand the 4 star rating. Nothing special. It's like fast food Greek, like Daphne's. Pretty mediocre. Plus they screwed up my online order, gave me gyro meat instead of chicken. Also, they didn't give me any utensils. Greek Pita is the way to go.
Got this for lunch today for the first time. It's so good I'm posting a review. Get the grilled chicken pita with fries! AH-mazing!!! Will definitely be going again.

Nothing special here, just food that is quick, cheap, and good. Stopped by after work to grab a quick dinner, $8.58 well spent. Had the greek beef night club souvlaki, with lentin soup. Food was pretty decent, have had better for the price. The lady at the cash register was friendly, and there is a bench by the entrance setup specifically for to-go patrons. I may give this place another chance next time I am in Scottsdale.
food is authentic! Didn't take long at all!! gyros + greek fries = heaven in my mouth  a little pricey but worth it!

If you like eating fast food then proceed. If not, then skip this place. The food was not fresh, you could tell the lettuce had been sitting out. They had tiny strips of onions, and a few baby cubes of bell peppers as the "veggies." The pita was way overstuffed with chicken. /: my boyfriend got the felafel pita... he took two bites, the second one he actually spit onto a napkin. I do not recommend this place, and will never be going back!
My grandson and I both got the kids meal gyros, his with fries, mine with rice and we both enjoyed them!  Great price too.  It's great to have this next to my doctor.  We will be back!  Thanks!

ok..  so there is this George's Gyros, and one on McKellips.  I am a Greek Salad lover so get them often.  Unfortunately i have to say that the George's on McKellips does a much better Greek Salad.  Its 50 cents more, but you get a lot more salad along w/ more peppers, cucumbers and olives.  And they also throw in a yummy piece of garlic bread.  Georges on Scottsdale does have a good salad, it is just not up to par to the one you get from Mckellips.  so!  I am hoping that they will read this and raise the bar a bit :-)
This place is so delicious. I work nearby and always stop here once a week for lunch. Tried almost everything on menu and everything is delicious. Of course their gyro sandwich is my favorite.
Outstanding food at reasonable prices. I had the gyro platter with dolmas, and all were tasty!  Highly recommend giving this place a try.

Good solid Mediterranean cuisine - generous portions, both salads and pitas.  All food delicious except the lemon lentil soup, which was a lacking in taste.  It was a tad pricey for a lunch bite. Very friendly service

This very nice fast casual restaurant is clean, cool and very delicious!   Some of the best Greek food that I have ever had.   Better than what I've had in Greece.   Do yourself a favor and give this place a try...you won't be sorry!

This place is so put together, organized and delicious that I had always thought they were part of a national chain, but they are actually locally- and family-owned!  Big props to the Mikha family!  They have plenty of vegetarian options, and I always make sure to get a side of their lentil soup - it's amazingly delish and fresh tasting!  It's sort of the opposite of George's... :)  Highly recommended and I will always come back!
Great food! Great service! Great price! You can't go wrong with the Mediterranean style lamb and beef wrap.

I've been here twice this week. The first time I had the gyro and let me tell you... One of the best gyros I've ever had. The meat was piled on and full of flavor, and I love that you can add jalapeños.  I also tried the hummus platter on the first visit. While they give you a good portion of hummus, I would say the flavor is pretty average. It was good but nothing to rave about.  On my second visit I had Mika's fries. AMAZING. Fries covered in gyro meat, Greek dressing, tzatiziki, and feta (I went without the feta.) This would definitely not be on any diet menu. The combined flavors are excellent, and the portion size could feed two people.   The place is clean and the workers are friendly. And they had the NFL draft on the flat screen, which was not what I would have expected at a Greek place - but a huge bonus.
This is a regular place for me to go to lunch. The Mediterranean Chicken Pita is delicious. The chicken is always hot and not dry All sides are good. I usually get Greek salad or Lentil soup

Great food BUT the clerk, she didn't know anything about the yelp free drink with check-in..and then when we showed it to her she said it PROBABLY isn't for this location. YIKES better do some training. BUT we will return the food is great needs to be spicier on the spicy GYRO thou. I think I prefer the wild guys at the McKellips location

Mika's Gyro and a side of fries was perfect! The portions were just right and there with a healthy amount of meat and fries that were nice and crispy. I now have a new lunch spot to throw in the Friday rotation. Can't wait to go back!

Well, I have only been here once and I liked it very much. My friend Alan had been here quite a few times, so I thought I would give it a try! It is located in a shopping center on the South West side of Scottsdale road, if that makes it easier to find it. Very simple inside,which is really all it needs to be. We ate outside because, it was a beautiful day. Not too hot yet. We ordered our food and then took a seat outside. Intending to go back in to collect our plates. One of the ladies was nice enough to bring it out to us. I got the gyro and lentil soup. I only got the soup because Alan said he really liked it. I really liked it as well! Very good, as well as very healthy. I did not get the fries because other reviews said they were cold many times. I instead got the Humus which was really good and tasted very fresh. I took a photo of Alan's meal. His was wonderful as well. I want to go back again and check it out some more. The one thing that was a bummer, no hot drinks. such as Hot teas.
I had a pita with gyro meat and it was amazing. It was hot, fresh, and a generous portion. The place itself is really clean, tasteful, and has a lot of seating. Would definitely come back.

Clean and modern inside. I ordered a grilled chicken plate with a salad on the side. Fresh ingredients, very light, pita bread was nice and warm. Great price for good portioned quality food. Def will come back!

Wonderful service from cashier with dark hair (may be Greek). Super friendly. I've managed in retail for 20 years and rarely have I witnessed such remarkable service. The food was very good... Very tasty and full of meat :-) prices were great and cleanliness was very good. 5 stars all the way around AND 10 to the cashier.
I didn't like it at all food was cooked to much , the price for what you get expensive , never back again
Amazing Greek food and the employees are always super friendly and helpful! Greekumbers are my fave

Great Greek food for cheap! It's almost like a Greek Panera. Although, I didn't realize at first that it was an "order-at-counter" place and not a waited-service restaurant. The workers did come by ask us how our meal was and took our plates when finished... overall, good experience, just not a real "restaurant."

We tried Mika's for the first time tonight. My husband and I were very impressed.  To start it was very clean! The service was great. I wish I would have taken a picture of our food because the portions were great. I had the beef slovaki plate and my husband had the lamb gyro pita. I will absolutely go back again and would recommend stopping in there.

Great Greek food and amazing service! The staff was so nice and the place was so clean. Ordered the Greek salad with gyro meat and it was perfect! Great portion size and good flavors! I would definitely go back!
Love the falafel and hummus plate!!! It was deserted when I went and my food was ready very quickly!

Sorry, but the food at this casual Greek spot really doesn't hold up to either it's pricing nor the other places around town to eat.   The chicken is as bland tasting as the soup was.  Nice staff unfortunately can't make up for totally mediocre food.

Not quite a fan, unfortunately.   The restaurant is very clean and has many tables for seating. It was empty when we first walked in around 11:30 am, and soon people were bustling for lunch rush. The employees at the counter are helpful when it comes to ordering and suggesting. However, for the type of food, I feel like it's overpriced. I ordered a falafel wrap with fries as my side. The "wrap" was gyro style with a pita bread so it was difficult to eat the falafel and enjoy the different sauces spontaneously. I was expecting shawarma style wrap.
Very modern, friendly and fantastic food. I am fortunate to work close by and stop in often. The manager/owner is very friendly. Overall great experience.

We stopped in for lunch.  Great "fast" Greek food.  The Greek Sampler was a great way to get a taste of everything.  The hummus was a bit salty, but the tzatziki sauce was amazing.  The vegetarian pita was so filling- large with grilled tomatoes, green peppers and onion.  You have to try the Greek fries- they tasted just like Greek roasted potatoes- with the added zing of some feta on top.  My husband said it tasted like a Greek wedding!  The gyros platter was plenty of food to split between too people.  The toasted pita that came with all meals were delish!  The only downside were the booths- you sink in when you sit- I would suggest some more padding in those or make sure you get a table with chairs.

I've driven past this location for at least a year and always said I need to check them out.  Instead of relying on the same old standard Friday night dinner fare, I picked Mika's to be the night's adventure.  My dinner mate and I ordered the hummus plate, Mika's fries (gyro meat, feta and tzatziki over fries) and gyro pitas with sides.  I could only make it through the appetizers!  The fries are quite possibly my newest addiction.  Everything has bright flavors and no one flavor over powers another.  I look forward to going back and trying the dolmades and lentil soup.  Until then, I still have leftovers for tomorrow's dinner!    Opa!
Food was not very good for the money. Middle Eastern food is my favorite and this was kinda disappointed.

This place just opened a few months ago along with a few other Greek restaurants in this area. There are now like 5 Greek places within a 2 mile radius of each other. Strange that they all picked this area. I think Mika's is one of the better ones though. The restaurant is also very modern in its look. Nice and clean too. You can see right into their kitchen and watch them shave the meat right off the big roasting block of meat. Their Gyros, the G is silent people, are really good. They add diced tomatoes to their Gyros which I think adds a nice flavor and is different from the usual. At least different form the Gyros I have gotten before. Their fries are pretty good too. Everyone in my office loves this place and every time they have a meeting they send me over here to get them lunch. I don't mind. I will back for sure. Maybe not all the time because it is over $5 for lunch but it is still not bad and their gyros are packed with beef so definitely worth the money. They have other specialty sandwiches that I might try at some point but it is hard to pass up a good Gyro.
Reallly good food! Definitely get the tzatziki sauce - best around. I had the chicken Greek salad, very refreshing and had a lot of chicken!

This section of Tempe has received a glut of Greek restaurants in the past year. Within a 2 mile radius there's  Niro's, Tzikii's, Café Greco and one other I can't remember the name of.  This place is solid! Yes, they are a little pricey but they are good. Aesthetically speaking this is probably one of the nicest Greek restaurants I've been too, everything is very clean. Their cash register is actually an IPad with Swype attached to it which is a little weird and cool all at the same time. Their side Greek salad is very proudly prepared, I hate when the side Greek salad sucks, but this one had all the fixins (olives, pepperoncini's, onions, feta, tomatoes, cucumbers). The Gyros are made to order, the meat is literally cut right off of the spit in front of you. I can't wait to make my way through the rest of the menu. I think this restaurant will be able to strongly compete against the other Greek restaurants in the area.

When we arrived a diligent young woman was mopping the floors which made me ask if they were closing.  No, she said.  Just cleaning.  And the place looked it.  Sparkling clean throughout.  I hope her boss knows how diligent she is about making the place look and smell clean.  Now to the food.  The way it works is that you go to the counter, order, pay and when it is ready they bring it to you.  We had the small platters which come with one side and pita.  Hubby had the greek chicken with the Greek salad.  I had the chicken souvlaki with french fries.  The greek chicken was chopped up chicken which made it a bit dry.  The Greek salad was good as were the pitas which accompanied each platter.  The chicken souvlaki was more like a shish-kabob, nice and juicy,  so mine was the better of the two dishes.  We also got a small side of yogurt which is traditional to Greek cuisine.   The young lady was friendly, the place was clean and the pricing was fair.  I would choose the chicken souvlaki over the greek chicken anytime.   It's worth a repeat visit.
This neighborhood niche is one of my favorite local restaurants. Give this place a shot people... Good guys...great food..!
Excellent food in a casual atmosphere. Prices are reasonable and servings generous. I definitely recommend it
Good quality food. Free WiFi. HiTech iPads for placing orders. Will e-mail or text receipts. A little pricy for a fast food bistro.
Delish and super fresh!! Had a gyro, falafels snd the baclava. Restaurant is immaculate, super impressed with cleanliness.

Very good food. We have had multiple meals all were good. Nice size servings. Service was excellent both times I went in. Right across street from St Joesph hospital. So if you are like me and have a family member here it is a huge help. I will be back!

This place is fantastic.  It is clean when you walk in.  Very classy ambience.  The fellas' cooking our meals were happy when they prepared it.  That makes all the difference in the world to see someone put their love into your meal.  The hummus and falafel is delicious. Everything is delicious!  We used to drive 4 miles to get Greek food.  Now we can walk from our house to get it.   Blown away!  Excellent customer service.

Solid selection if meats, salads, hummus, toppings, ect. The service was fast and really quite friendly. They accept credit cards, cash, and even square if you are into that movement. The original gyro and side salad is honestly more than enough food to feed one for dinner. They also have a wheat pita option but you might have to ask. The ambience is clean, quiet, and nice all around. Parking out front is a little hectic but I believe there is more around the back. Enjoy! I know I will be back when I return to Phoenix.

We decided to stop by Mika's Greek after seeing some positive Yelp reviews & I was definitely not disappointed.  I asked the friendly man at the register what he would recommend between the Greek Grilled Chicken pita & the Chicken Souvlaki pita ... he said the Greek Grilled Chicken so I got that with a side of fries. It wasn't busy at all so the food came out really fast and I could tell it was fresh since everything was way too piping hot to be consumed right away.  As for the taste, I'd say it was good. The pita came with diced tomatoes, onions, & their house made tzatziki. The chicken was a bit on the salty side but tasted good with combined with everything else.  I found it to be very clean inside the restaurant too, which was great. It was very modern looking & well maintained. I'll definitely be back.

Don't really eat Greek food as it's not very popular locally.  But I would always try any food at least once.  And I really glad that I came to Mika's one night.  This place was tucked in the very back at a shopping plaza between Scottsdale & Tempe.  It was hard to find at first, but lucky I found this gem in time before they closed for the night.  I ordered Mediterranean Chicken Pita with Fries and my friend ordered Original Tyro Pita, also with Fries.  And since this is Greek food, Falafel appetizer is a must, so we ordered that as well.  The flavoring was very tasty, but I'm still not a fan of this type of food.  But at least I gave it a try, hopefully I"ll have better review next time.

I was in the area and heard this place was great so I stopped by and had lunch. Got here around 12:30 and they were busy. A great sign to know your gonna get served fresh food. And Fresh Food it was! I had the Picado Pita, the meat was juicy and fresh, perfect amount of spice to the pita. The fries were great, not dropping oil like other places.    The service was very friendly and the food was pretty quick. I recommend this place to everyone. A must try especially if your near by!

Read the reviews about the café and my aunt and I had to try it. Had the lentil soup and if you like split pea you'll love this! the Souvlaki  chicken pita was good and they don't spare the sauce!! I never had hummus before and the jalepeno hummus has me as a fan. My aunt had a gyros with salad and raved! I don't know if they had any but some baklava & greek coffee would top off meals there. Thumbs-UP

Had very high hopes for this establishment. First of all my cousin and I came here hungry and ready to eat. Jose the not so friendly cashier kept looking at my chest. I went to sit down with my cousin who had already ordered her food, and got us a booth. I told her that I thought the cashier was creepy and how he kept looking at my chest, she looked at me and said that she thought he was looking at her chest as well.  Aside from that the food portions were a joke. My meat was cold, and it started to upset my stomach. French fries were good, just make sure to bring the salt because these had none!
Great food and clean. I will come here again. I had the Mikas Fries and the Greek Sampler   Thank you

Yummy Greek food! I came here for a lunch meeting and definitely enjoyed the gyro wrap with fries.  The restaurant is very clean and the staff is friendly and professional for the most part. The fountain drink machine gives you large selection of sodas to choose from with unlimited refills.   It was my first time there so I wanted to try a nice wrap, but the menu definitely has various salads and other items I will definitely be trying soon. I would recommend this to anyone look for quick and good Greek food!

I ordered the chicken gyro and my boyfriend had the lamb gyro platter. The meat was perfect, not overdone at all and was well seasoned. The veggies were fresh. It was reasonably priced especially for the atmosphere and the fact that you get real plates (I like that little detail.) The outdoor seating is a plus too. I would definitely come back.

Well, what a pleasant little surprise this place turned out to be!  Truth be told, we had headed for a different restaurant nearby and they were unexpectedly closed early on a Saturday - what???  So as we were exiting the parking lot, we saw the sign and said why not? What do we have to lose?  Apparently, the other restaurant's loss was our gain!  This is a great little hidden gem!  We passed on appetizers.  I ordered a Greek chicken platter with Greek salad and the DH had a gyro platter with Greek salad. Then an order of Greek fries...just because. Opa!  First of all, this place is very inexpensive and that is critical to keep in mind during the review.  When the order comes out, it is plated as nicely as a restaurant costing twice as much. They took care to make the platter look attractive. There was a wonderful salad full of nicely fresh and chopped veggies and pepperoncini.  Lightly dressed. And mine was without onions as requested.  The salad was larger than I get in a lot of restaurants as a side order and yummy.  Then came the meats.  Gyro meat is gyro meat - unless you grill the crap out of it, there is not much to distinguish it from another restaurants's so lets just say it was fresh and hot as it should be.  The Greek chicken........yum. Just yum. The breast was nicely marinated and cooked perfectly - not dried out, not crispy on the edges, just cooked perfectly.  Did I mention this was an inexpensive restaurant and yet the care they take with their food beats a lot of $$ restaurants.  The pita came out hot and fresh as well. And the Greek fries were just darned tasty - they were tossed in the house Greek dressing and topped with feta - and I almost had to arm wrestle DH for the last of them and I am not a huge fry eater but these were too fresh and tasty to pass up.  And - side note on the fries - despite the fact that they were tossed with a little dressing, they were not limp and soggy.  They knew exactly how to prepare them to keep them from turning into a hot mess.  In all honesty - I could not even finish my platter!  And it was so good, I tried - and I took those leftovers home and did NOT split them with the pup!  Kudos to Mika's - we will be back again despite the fact that I can find closer Greek restaurants.  You are worth the drive!  Scorecard: Cleanliness - 5 stars Price - 5 stars Quality - 5 stars Portions - 5 stars  What's not to like???

Placed a delivery order and when it arrived I was missing food.  Fine.  But when I called I had to ask for a refund because they didn't offer to bring the food!  No dinner for me I guess.  Had this restaurant had halfway decent customer service, we would have been regulars.  Unfortunately first impressions last.  Thumbs down.

We ordered for deliver for three people.  $40 with delivery not too bad for the amount of food we got.  We find that they are the most flavorful and best value.  So far ordered 5 times and no disappointments!   This is my third review and so far still impressed!!!

We are from the western suburbs of Chicago my husband and I think this food is better than any Greek restaurant.  I order the Greek chicken platter side of Greek salad and he order the gyros platter outstanding food with great customer service
Really great restaurant! Very clean and has a more sophisticated vibe than other basic Greek restaurants. Friendly staff and the pita options are awesome! Definitely recommend.
Great ambience. Nice decor and pleasant environment. Tasty food, nice service. Huge options to choose from. One of the nice Greek restaurants in the valley.

So to start with this restaurant is very clean and impeccable, when you walk in you can see into the kitchen and see how your food is being prepared, which is always good. Also, the gentleman there told me they get their produce locally sourced, which is another good sign.  I ordered the Greek sampler with Dolmas, hummus, falafel and tzatiki to go. It is supposed to have pita but I am Gluten sensitive so they added extra cucumber instead. The meal was quickly prepared and I was on my way.    I didn't get to eat it while it was piping hot, but that was my fault. What I can tell you is the dolmas was nicely spiced, and very filling even without meat, which is how I was used to eating them. The hummus was very good too. You could taste the freshness. And the falafel which in my experience tends to be a little dry, dipped in hummus or tzatiki was very tasty.   I will be back, I look forward to trying more of the meals and think this Greek restaurant franchise concept, if they can all prepare food this well will be a great addition.

I have been coming here since before it was Mikas and they always do a good job!  I wish the prices were a bit lower, but the place is big and I would assume its a fairly high-rent area. That aside I have never had a bad meal here, the portions are good, and you all know I love my Gyros!  The service is fast, and the food is fresh, they have plenty of seating and the ambiance is nice.

Greek food is on the top of my list so I can be a bit critical. With that said, this place is incredible. Service is always great and the food even better. Authentic high quality Greek food. Try the Picado Pita or the Greeks fries. Def won't be disappointed.

I felt like trying something new and I live right by Mikas.I have driven by thinking I need to try that place since I love Greek food. I tried it today and it was amazing. I had the original gyro and it was loaded with meat and it was perfectly cooked. I also had the jalapeño hummus and Greek wings. All were excellent. The restaurant was also very clean and nice. I called in my order and it was ready when I got there. Highly recommended.

thought i'd try this place since its so near work but this is definitely the first and only time i'll go to Mika's. i ordered the gyro platter ($12.95) with fries and salad. at first glance this price is a little steep compared to other greek restaurants in the area ($8.95 or $9.95). with a drink my lunch came to about $16. a little high but i figured i'd give this place a shot.   i ordered to go and had to wait for about 20 min before my food was ready. i was a little disappointed to see the size of the portions (this is a $16 lunch meal...). getting this back to the office and digging in, i'm equally saddened by the just average taste. the fries are not salted or crispy, the salad is bland, and the meat ... well it was definitely not plentiful and definitely not seasoned enough.  all in all a really disappointing experience. YC's or jimmy john's will be getting my business when i turn into that plaza.

A random stop for a great lunch. This was a unique place that offered about eight ways to enjoy your lunch pita and basically get free fries or rice with your meal. Most pita's were about 8 bucks. I chose the chicken which was marinated in some heavy garlic and spices and thrown on a pita with feta and other stuff. The strips of chicken were well seasoned and all white meat and it was a good eating experience. The fries could have been a tad crispier, but otherwise a good side dish choice. All packed to go and it was still hot after a 20 minute drive home.
Fast friendly service, fresh Greek salad, comfortable open atmosphere, a great place for lunch.

WOW! I chose this place because I read a few nice reviews... Guess what, those reviews lied!! My husband and I walked into this very "tecky" style place. (next to Jimmy Johns which is where we should have gone) They have menus on flat panel TVs and a very neat ipad looking checkout counter. We went to a booth to wait for our food and had a different setting then normal. The booths are VERY wide. When we got our food it was awkward to eat because the seat is farther from the table then it should be.(The table does move, but still is not planned well for groups/couples to sit across from each other) We were sitting on the edges of the booth and still leaning to eat.Now for the food we did get... We both ordered gyros, my husband got the soup and I got the salad. The soup was so bland and tasteless we could not figure out what it was. The texture was weird too. I caved and asked the girl what it was and she said it was lentil soup. I don't know where hey got their recipe, but it needs revised. My salad was dressed with a dressing that wasn't shaken, it was very oily and also bland. The gyros had nice pita bread, but that was it. They are not shy on the amount of meat you get, but it has no flavor either!! The tatziki was very watery and the tomatoes not ripe yet. All in all, the food is substance and that is about it.

Best Greek food I have had in the valley. Great service, beautiful/modern decor, fancy technology for credit cards, the coke machine with approximately 3848382 options AND Gold Peak tea. Oh, and yummy-tastic food, too.   Original Gyro and Greek fries are where it's at. The salad is good and friends have told me the chicken gyro is tasty. Even when busy(swamped during noon hour), food comes out quickly and they bring it to you based on your receipt number. When on my hour lunch break, we would have 1/2 hour to spare when we went at an off time 11 or 1:30. Wish they had more seating but, hey, it's a small building. Try it. You won't be disappointed!

I'm crazy for Mika's Greek. So far i have had the Caesar and the  diablo Caesar pitas. They are both so yummy. The pita bread always tastes so fresh with  grilled chicken that is seasoned just so.  For sides i have had the rice and also paid a bit more for the Greek fries which are topped with chunks of feta and drizzled with a vinaigrette (which they put on the side for to orders so they don't get soggy in the bag- smart). They are so tasty and different then #BasicBitchFries. I've been telling all my friends to go for awhile now so needed to write a review to tell the Yelpians to go!

Well laid out, well lit, comfortable, clean, and professional and friendly service. AND AMAZING FOOD. I feel the desert was lacking though. I'm no expert but the baklava tasted old or over done. The pastry layer was really dry, airy, and flaky and the bottom layer was hard and chewy. The flavor was like baklava I've had before so I will likely give it a better look next time before I try the baklava again as I will be back.   It could have just been that the day ate here, the oven broke and the baklava was burnt. The menu is simple and offers and great assortment of options in food and beverages. I'm a stickler for good service so where Mika's Greek would usually get 5 stars, I wish I could give 7 1/2 stars for everything else.
Close to work. Easy and fast. Will go back.  Don't need to write more just because I think it's simply good.  RL

I had their food at an event that was catered, and it was pretty good. Not impressed with anything at the actual restaurant though. The chicken was over seasoned and dry, the rice tasted old and was hard, and the gyro meat was not tasty at all.  But, the prices are low and the staff was very friendly...

My go to spot if I'm looking for a quick healthy option. Food is tasty with great quality ingredients. Not your typical greasy late night Greek spot. The restaurant itself was recently remodeled and very cute inside and service is always very fast.
Tremendous food and service. Quick, delicious, and healthy. Great music as well, I heard the yeah yeah yeah's while eating chicken souvlaki on my lunch break one day and it was tremendous.

Not the best chicken. It appears to be pre-cut chicken strips and they are not marinated well or seasoned. Edible, but not the best chicken that could be used. Side salad is kinda tiny as well with hardly any feta cheese present in a greek salad. Plus the pita did not hold up well to-go. It steamed itself in the plastic and came out steamed, wet and clammy. Second time not the charm.

I had the Greek salad pita it was fantastic.  I have to say that I was not a big fan of how large the cucumbers were sliced but that didn't take away from the flavor! The staff was very nice and the place is very clean!

Yum! The food is great, the restaurant is clean and the team was friendly and quick! The menu provides various options and being close to work is a plus as well. I highly recommend the Picado Pita.. Your traditional gyro with a kick of jalapeño!

Best Greek restaurant in the 3 mile area. Ordered the chicken and gyro plate. Portions on the plates were very good. Enough left over to make breakfast with some eggs. Hummus was also good. Prices were reasonable. Ordered carry out through the Yelp app. Order was ready on time. Didn't dine in but the restaurant looked clean and nice. Has the new style of soda machine that does the flavor add ins.
Mika's Greek is one of the best. Always fresh and plenty of options. i've had their chicken, the lamb and the beef and all three are really great. It never disappoints!

Mika's Greek's is an extremely clean 'n tidy counter service cafe serving a simple menu of Greek standards. The lunchtime staff (same two guys that always seem to be working) are friendly and efficient. The food is spot on in the fresh department....not greasy or heavy! Mika's Greek is a solid stop for lunch! I definitely recommend it.

I used to like this place ok... Even though right when you walk in you smell sewage(ever since it opened). They changed their menu around and I ordered beef souvlaki and chicken($14 for 1 meal). Their hummus is subpar. The thing that was disgusting was the beef souvlaki. I have eaten at many Mediterranean restaurants and every one of them serve grilled beef chunks as souvlaki. Then they have a ground beef sausage/long hamburger patty called beef kafta.  The chicken souvlaki here is grilled pieces of chicken. So I open up my meal when I get home and the "souvlaki" is a long poop looking herbed hamburger patty. Ewwwwwwwww. Not going back. False advertising. Overpriced as well.

Love this place! The best Greek food. Everything is so fresh while still quick and affordable. They always have awesome specials and offer large portions. Happy to say we have become regulars here! Make sure to try the Tzatziki...mmm delicious!

I kind of oscillated between 3 and 4 stars, and decided on 4 stars for the overall experience.  The food overall was probably 3 stars.  Very nice shop.  Nice and clean, modern, and a very friendly lady working at the counter.  Free WiFi, too.  I asked a couple of questions about the menu and she gave me the info I needed, then I ordered.  I got the gyro with a side salad and a drink, all for $10.77.  Good price.  Free refills on sodas with a self-serve fountain station.  Plenty of extra parking behind the store with a rear entrance.  One thing I wish it had more of was sauce, both for the salad and the cucumber sauce for the gyro.  Everything tasted fine but I did wish I had asked for some extra on the side.  The gyro itself is typical, but I'm a bit spoiled.  My favorite place has large, soft strips of meat so I'm a bit disappointed by the places that serve the thinner, harder strips.  It tends to make the dish feel a bit average.  If you want to stand out you have to do something different.  But like I said, the place and experience was good overall.  I enjoyed eating there and I'll return.

This place is amazing. Every ingredient is delicious and even better together. I got the grilled Greek chicken with rice and tztaziki platter. The pita is also soft and perfect. I highly recommend! This place is my new Greek go to!

Stopped in a few weeks ago while visiting the Scottsdale area.  Food was good, not great, service was good.  Not a bad place at all, just not a wow must try spot, but if you are in the area & in the mood for Greek I would not hesitate to try Mika's

We've been a few times to Mika's Grill and we haven't been disappointed.  Usually we order gyro or chicken and with the sides it's just enough food to fill us up.  I would recommend Mika's to anyone.  Very Good!
This was our first visit and we will definitely come back!  The food was very good, the dining room was very clean price was great for the amount of food we received! The Greekumbers were very yummy!

Fast delicious Mediterranean food that you'll love.  Great place for lunch when you are limited on time.   I had the gyros platter with side salad for $7.95, lots of meat and sprinkled with feta cheese.

I personally live down the street. I love this place. They really have a great menu. There fast and friendly and to be honest you really can't beat the service here! If I was looking for the food again I would definitely come here.

Easy 5 stars. The food is really good for the price! Adding Sriracha to greek food is so delicious and the Diablo Pita was ridiculously good. Daniel, who worked here (Manager maybe?), was really friendly and the service was awesome. I had a diablo pita with chicken and a greek salad and they were both awesome. I would highly recommend this place for some quick greek deliciousness!

Given it was 8:10pm when we called in our pick-up order, I guess I would expect the quality, but my boyfriend and I were hoping for more since we paid $30 for our meal. We ordered a gyro and greek chicken plate with fries and a salad in addition to a chicken souvlaki wrap, mediterranean style with fries and a couple drinks. Our hot fries were placed next to cold veggies in plastic to go containers that don't seem heat safe; fries were soggy and otherwise lacking. I got two hunks of whole chicken breast and a few slices of pickle and onion with a weak spread of sauce, not what I had in mind. My boyfriend was disappointed his large plate didn't come with pita, and that his "greek" chicken was no different from my chicken "souvlaki." All in all, we thought we'd try something new, and it disappointed. I get it, an hour til close on a Monday night, but come on, slice the chicken.

When we received food it was cold.  I'm from Chicago so having the gyro and the chicken has to be the disgusting thing I've tasted.   I will not go here again or recommend this place to anyone! This has got to be the worst Gyro and Chicken I've ever had in my life.

This is a new find for us. We really like it! The food is good, really fresh. The soup they serve is amazing ,a type of yellow Lentil soup. Hummus is a big Yes. Very good as well. I would come here whenever I could. You can eat inside or outside. Good prices and good Food.  Easy to get to  as well. Right in the shopping center on the South-West corner of Scottsdale Road and McDowell.
While the food wasn't what I am used to when it comes to Greek food , the restaurant was very nice, clean and the service was amazing

Visiting from California. Love Greek. I had another Greek/Mediterranean while I was here. Mika's was much better quality and the service was speedy. For the price it is Definitely one of the best Greek restaurants I have tried. Give it a shot!
Nice little place with nice people. Tried jalapeño hummus, large palate with grilled Greek chicken and falafel. Food is awesome! Would be perfect if a couple more beverage options are there.

I have been here a few times before and even ordered it to-go to take back home with me! The Mediterranean pita is delicious, absolutely in LOVE with the Greek fries, and the chicken caeser one is pretty good too! Highly recommend this place!

This place is awesome the only issue is sometimes an older lady works there and wears bright lip stick she can be a bit stuck up! But everyone other then her is super down to earth. The food is amazing it's our favorite Greek restaurant!

Just like the Mika's next to my office in Scottsdale. Very clean, extremely friendly, and excellent food per usual. Get the diablo! The sariacha makes it killer. Also, not sure how they do it, but the fries are better than any I've had anywhere.
It's okay.  French fries were a disappointment.  They were soggy.  The gyro was average. I would come back to try something else on the menu.
Greek night club is sooooo good! Fresh vegetables and awesome feta. The rice is a little bland but good salads. Also... Siracha on tap! First time I've seen this

Stopped by for lunch with a co-worker the other day and left happy that we found this place. It was clean, affordable, and the service was quick. I had a chicken pita that was delicious. The Greek fries were yummy and I found myself trying to copy them at home. My co-worker had the lentil soup and the chicken platter and said it was excellent.

The food was good although it was pretty expensive for what you get. The issue we really had was how rude the cashier girl was to us. She acted like we ruined her night by coming in late and seemed so annoyed when we ordered an extra hummus when we got there. I probably will look for another place

Tried this place for the first time and its amazing. We tried the Mika's Fries with gyro and it was amazing. The portion is good for two. Food was fresh and yummy. The atmosphere is really cool and the restaurant is clean. I recommend this place to friends and neighbors.
Yummy Greek food to satisfy all your Mediterranean cravings.  Simple, busy and clean place to grab a bite.

We love this place!  I work at ASU Skysong and my coworkers and I frequent this shop for lunch.  The service is always great, the food is good and the baklava is to die for!  We also have them cater for our office on occasion and they have never disappointed.  Definitely a good place to check out.
Chicken, gyro and flafel, was over cooked and flavorless. For this quality of food, it was way over priced and not edible at all.
Really, really clean as other reviewers have stated. Building used to be sushi eye. I got the chicken souvlaki pita platter with side salad. Everything was really fresh. No complaints to speak of!

I've been here quite a few times, finally getting around to writing the review. I love MIKA's. Service is always fast and attentive. Food is always fresh and hot. I typically do the Mediterranean pita or Greekpeño with chicken. The Greek fries are so delicious and have the right amount of feta cheese. Whenever I crave pita, I come here.

Holy bananas! I just tried this place as a recommendation from people I work with...amazing! Service was relatively fast as I walked in and ordered to go. Everything smelled amazing and my food tasted so good!

We eat there a few times a month, food & service is always outstanding.  The place is very clean, they have a few tables out front.  Not much else in the old Papago Plaza, so lots of parking.  Highly recommend.

This place is really nice and clean inside.  I ran inside to order my food and the cashier (I think her name was Amy?) helped me out.  I paid and ran back to my car that was still running because my dog was inside.  I usually never take him with me in the summer but the power was out in my neighborhood and it was too hot to leave him home.  I explained my situation to the lady at the counter.  Anywho, I saw her pack my food...and then she brought it out to me.  I know this is a simple act, but it really means a lot to me when someone takes an extra step to make your day easier or better.  The chicken was amazing!!  But I mostly give 5 stars for the customer service!! I will be back soon!! Thanks Amy :)

I ordered pick up and my partner went and got the food. We live very close and when she got home the food was still hot and might I say very yummy! Since this was our first visit we played it safe with a gyro and side salad and the greekumbers. Wow! Needless to say we will be back. Would be great if you all delivered as I am home with an injury and would love to have your food more frequently.

I enjoy coming here for lunch during the work week for a quick and somewhat healthier option. The chicken and gyro are always tasteful and fresh, however I am not very fond of their side options. The rice is very bland and has zero flavor which is unfortunate considering their chicken and gyro are both tasty. It's a great local spot for a quick bite but can easily be forgotten about.

I was in the area when I had a sudden craving for Greek food.  I had the small platter with beef souvlaki.  $7.95. Delicious!  I wouldn't get the large unless you're sharing or super hungry. Lots of food.  Very clean and new inside.

It's a hit or a miss. I have been when they served great food and unfortunately I have also been here while receiving terrible service and food from the meat head at the counter. My gf was appalled that the Caesar salad had lettuce, old cheese and drenched in Caesar dressing. I feed animals in a more humane manner lol. Never going here again!

Quick place to grab a quick bite to eat in Central Phoenix.   Nice staff and good food at a reasonable price.  I enjoyed the dolma platter with a greek salad and rice.  It was the perfect portion, flavorful and freshly made.
Great! Great! Great! I ordered enough to have leftovers, however it was so good, i couldn't help myself and ate it all. The whole menu is a go.
Had original gyros and a Greek salad. Loved it. Very fresh. And the Greek dressing was perfect. I'll come back and try more items on the menu.
Chicken souvlaki plate. Chicken terrible. Fatty. Undercooked. Rice absolutely tasteless. Pita was fine. No reason to give this a second try. Ewww
Grabbed a gyro and a tea for lunch. Restaurant was clean, staff was kind, lots of folks eating there when I showed up. Price was average for a gyro, I would go back.
This place is fresh, fast and delicious. It's a breath of fresh air for Greek food. A must visit when you have the hankering.

This small unassuming strip mall restaurant is a five star gem. Several co-workers had been there and came back raving, so yesterday we went as a group. Going with five people let me see the awesome quality across five different plates. We all had something different and all enjoy generous portions of quality food. Perfectly cooked meats, not over seasoned served, with various sides for under $10 each.   The service was also perfect. You order at the counter where they will eagerly answer questions or accommodate requests. They then bring out your delicious plate soliciting feedback and ensuring your enjoyment.   You can't go wrong with great service, quality food, generous portions, and reasonable prices. Mika's delivers squarely on all points and earns my five star review.

This place is horrific. Customer service is horrible. The only plus since weve dined there a couple times was a very nice young blonde girl was so friendly and was a asset to this company and i have not seen here recently but I will no longer spend another penny in this place. This owner is absolutely in the clouds with what is going on in their facility.
From the service, to the soups, to the salads and main dishes this place is one to put on the list! You will definitely be back for more.
Great little Greek restaurant! The staff is friendly and welcoming. Stumbled upon this place through groupon and really glad I did! Their gourmet gyros was amazing!!!! I will definitely be back.

Highly recommend this place. I order the Greek salad and Euro and have had a few other items here as we'll. All have been very good. The people here are always very friendly and provide good service. As far as the price, its very similar to many other Greek restaurants I've visited. Great healthy food and worth every penny.
My new go to Greek spot!  I live walking distance away and I'm glad I finally checked this place out. Everyone was so friendly, the place was clean, and the food was amazing. Will come back for sure

So. Darn. Good. Randomly happened across this place yesterday (moved my daughter into a condo nearby). The food here is amazing. I had a Greek salad with chicken and my mom had the diablo pita  with chicken. Everything was fresh, prepared to order and absolutely delicious. I should have taken pics but I was so hungry I couldn't wait!  I will go back every time I visit my daughter. The owners were so nice and treated us as if we were visiting their home. Go here. You will be glad you did.
No flavor to the food. I had to pour hot sauce all over it (which is not normal for me and Greek food) just to taste something. There is much better Greek food in town!!

The falafel is delicious and fresh. The Mediterranean pita is delicious. The tziki and hummus are great. Try the Greek fries. You won't be sorry. The service was good and the people were friendly. Everything was clean and welcoming. Put Mika's in your mouth.

We have been here more then a couple times and each time is very satisfying. I always get the chicken pita wrap with fries and my husband gets the lamb wrap. Prices are reasonable and I like the convenient area. We prior to us finding this location we would go to the one by scottsdale and McDowell rd.

Visiting Downtown Phx, us Mesa folks had no idea where to find good Greek food in the area. So we googled and still.. we got lost. Randomly driving to find a freeway, disappointed and hungry.. we saw in the corner of our eye this tiny beautiful white house with a cute patio for diners. We saw GREEK FOOD.  Ordered the gyro sandwich meal.. Super good!!  Cute restaurant, nice atmosphere, Amazingly great food and End of story!

This place lacks authenticity and consistency! I understand the current owners are not Greek's but that should not stop them from making some delicious Greek food if invested. The price range is ok but the quality of poor is poor.

Mika's was great! Not only the food was great and very reasonable, staff is friendly and knowledgable about everything on the menu. The owner is right there in the front  talking to the customers, I will definately be back!

This review requires very little, All I want to say is you have to eat here. Me and my wife are frequent customers and we recommend Mika's Greek to everyone we know. The food is absolutely amazing, like the melt in your mouth chicken souvlaki is a must. They also have the valleys #1 Greek salad in my opinion. Defiantly go for dinner tonight :-)

Gyro platter was a decent size portion for lunch. Our food came out quick but then again we were the only customer. I'm usually Leary about eating at a place with no customers but I can say food was good and don't know why they don't have a large customer base right across from a large hospital.
The gyro sandwich and Greek salad were excellent. Looking forward to coming back in the future.

I love this place.  It's just down the road from my house and I always order the original with fries and my girlfriend gets the same.  Always take 10 minutes to prepare and always fresh!  Highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

I went to their website and ordered online. I set the location as the one on Southern and Mill. But for some reason it sent the order to the Elliot store. Now I have to drive all the way across town to pick up food that I put in at a different store. The guy at the store I went to was rude. And now my food will be cold when I finally get to the other side of Tempe to pick it up I will never order from here again

I happened to see this restaurant today and decided to go in. I LOVE Greek food. I had a pita with gyros and some Basmati rice. It was truly delicious. The only thing, that I really did not care for, was the 2 big pieces of pickles in there, which was really no big deal, since I took them out.. The rice was very good as well.Amy, the server was very friendly.  I can truly recommend this restaurant with the best of conscience!

This is a perfect place for some quick and satisfying Greek food. It's not the highest quality or does not have the best ambience, yet it is very convenient. You get to choose your sides as well, soup, salad, fries!
Mikas is the best Greek food in town. The customer service is always awesome. I recommend this place to everyone.

Lately, I've been craving Greek food. And lucky for me, I've had a few opportunities in recent weeks to partake. Today, lunch at Mika's Greek was suggested by one of the quieter "culinary co-horts". I had no idea this awesome little joint was hiding in my backyard at the south end of Papago Plaza! Mika's is clean, modern and comfortable. They even have a Coke Freestyle dispenser. More on that later.  True to form, I ordered something "gyro" related. My Gyro Platter (with one meat and one side) was a generous portion and very reasonable for less than eight dollars. Lunch was filling, healthy and so tasty! I'm glad I was a creature of habit today, because it made it easier to make a decision in the face of so many options.  Now about that soda machine... Right after one of my co-workers filled his drink, the touch screen indicated that nearly all the choices were unavailable. All I had at this point was a cup of ice.
