An employee tried to fix this by re-booting the machine. She also offered me a bottle of Coke as an option. I declined and waited patiently, returning two more times, only to find the screen slowly re-booting. When the dispenser was working again, it was still missing about 80% of the options. However, I managed to dispense a surprisingly good Cherry Mello Yello Zero. Random, huh?  Unfortunately, when I returned for a refill, the machine looked like it was working properly, but my Cherry Coke was flat... I can't deduct a star, even after that. The food at Mika's was too good! See you again soon!
Very good, fresh salad. Chicken perfectly spiced.

Ordered the Mediterranean Chicken pita and the thin sliced chicken is dry and french fries were over cooked or sitting around for awhile. They were soggy in the middle. My second experience like this. Friendly and clean place but pitas are average. "King of Gyros" on Warner is way better. Just a honest review. Throw out fries if they are not fresh. Bad fries can kill the deal.
Love this place! They have a delicious Greek salad and I always add Greek chicken. It's wonderful and a good size salad. Their Greek fries are out of this world too!

Just check this place out today.  upon walking in I noticed the place is immaculately clean, well-designed and functional for big or small groups.  The guy behind the counter who made the food  was super nice and friendly.  I ordered the gyro special with side Mediterranean salad Salad was super fresh, perfect amount of dressing. Gyro meat was perfectly shaved right off fresh.. tender moist. the pita was also moist and perfect. Ziki sauce was on point as well.     Will definitely return
The service was very nice! I haven't really eaten Greek food before and the last was really nice explaining the differences between the meals. I'd liked it a lot
I love Mika's Greek!! It is Always fresh and the prices are just right. I highly recommend this place!
Mika's was super fast and friendly. The food is good. We got the gyro salads. Definitely want to try the Jalapeno Hummus! Definitely check it out.

Absolutely delicious. I discovered them by going to Jimmy John's and then deciding on them instead since they are next door. Glad I did. I can never turn down Greek food. Everything here is delicious. I usually get the Chicken Souvlaki Pita with a Greek Salad. Amazing. I have never been disappointed. I really like that when I pay with my card I can earn stars, and after 10 meals I get one free. Wonderful staff, always smiling and very friendly. Definitely would recommend.
Great place to pick up a flatbread sandwich and salad for lunch. The food is a great value, and always great service.

The food was tasty but I don't think I'll be back. The guy who took my order wasn't that friendly. It's a little pricey for a fast food lunch.  I got the 2 item combination plate with the drink and it was $16.95. Who can afford that at lunch? Also the plates slide all over the because the tables are so slippery.

Always fast and fresh. One of my favorite Mediterranean place, their gyro platter with greek salad is a must. You get the tasty marinated meat, warm bread and very generous and healthy salad for a reasonable price. Add to that the very fast service,  and the large choice of beverages from the dispenser, you get a perfect place to have a quality lunch. Also the restaurant is always very clean and well maintained.
Don't judge a book by its cover, considering this is in Papago Plaza. Mikas Greek is very nice inside, with a modern twist. The food is always fresh and the customer service is on point.

Went last month on a weekday afternoon.  We timed it perfectly to arrive post-lunch rush, and were looking for meatless options that provide ample fill up.  The food portions are great, everything's fresh and the staff is friendly.  Will definitely be back, maybe for dinner next time.

I've stopped by Mika's a couple times to eat in and take out. The menu has great variety and have yet to find an item I didn't like! Good price, friendly staff, and wonderful food. I'd recommend for a quick lunch and definitely try all the hummus/dips.

They had awesome food at an affordable price. We paid just under 8 bucks and got a large overflowing Gyro and it came with a side. I got a whole bowl of lentil soup. It definitely didn't disappoint! Wish we had some places like this near me.

I was surprised by this little place! Saw them pop up about a month or so ago. Nice to have another place open on Saturdays close to my neighborhood as most are closed weekends. Decor is clean and modern, customer service was good, and food was done quickly. I was happy to see they cooked and prepared everything while I waited so it was fresh. I orded a greek chicken platter with rice and salad as my sides. Chicken was flavorful and moist, rice was perfectly tender and spiced, salad was fresh and had the right amount of everything. I was happy their tziki sauce was light and creamy and the pita was fluffy. I will definitely be back.

Not to be confused by the George's Gyros on Mckellips and Miller.  This location is definitely a bar above that one.  The restaurant itself is very clean, air conditioned, and pleasant to be inside.  TV's are present to keep you entertained while you dine-in, or wait for your take-out order.  It was a little hard to find, as it's on the backside of Papago Plaza, I didn't even know this place was there until I found myself lost, and starving.  The food is pretty standard Greek food.  Delicious gyros, greek salad, etc., more often than not delivered by a Greek god of an owner.  It's nearly worth going to this place just to see him.

We thought the food was great here. Fresh and priced right. The sampler plate was generous and delicious. The chicken skewers and salad were very good also. Sat outside but the inside was nice too.  I'd say this place is worth going back to often!
Fresh, delicious and conveniently quick! I've been twice and the food/service is consistently top notch. The "Chipotle" of Greek food
Great. Quick accurate and always good. I like the whole menu. The desserts are really sweet and really good

wow went into mika's today 3-9-17 and was going to use a coupon I have from my Verizon smart rewards program, but didn't have a printer to print up the coupon. after a mixup the owner hooked me up with the same coupon which he didn't have to do but he showed his professionalism and took care of it. the food was top notch, had the picado pita with rice and was delicious not to mention the baklava. please, if you are in tempe near mill and southern and want something different, give Mika's a shot you won't be disappointed!
Always fresh and tasty. Great service.  Greekumbers and Greek chicken platter are tops!

Best greek food around my work and when I'm craving a Gyro, but can't get to Haji Baba. Food comes out quick. The pitas have massive amounts of meat and come with a side. Get the salad or soup (lentils) and you'll be super pleased. My friends say the fries and rice are also great.
Awesome and tasty food. Quick and fresh with a take out feel even taken in house. Friendly service. Clean and open environment. Suggest lunch here.
Lovely atmosphere. Attentive service even though you order from the counter. Food fresh and tasty; delightful quantities adequate. I will be returning. The location is excellent and easy.

Haven't had time to write a dazzling 5 start review of this place yet but after my delicious hummus plate, I figured I may as well. Every time I walk into this place I am greeted by smiling face that seem genuinely happy to be at their job. The owner is always around and is also very pleasant. This is one of the cleanest places I have ever eaten, you can tell the employees and owner take great pride in their appearance because this place is sparkling. The food is delicious, the BEST Greek in Tempe. GO FOR THE JALAPEÑO HUMMUS, you'll never go back to pita jungle.
Mikas Greek is awesome!  The food is the bomb and the service and ambience was exceptional. We went to the MK on Mill and Southern last night and all I can say is Welcome to the Neighborhood!
I really liked this restaurant. Food was fresh and had great flavors. I loved the cucumber salad and I can't wait to go back and have it again!

I'm visiting arizona from California and i wanted to try something new. Stopped by here and didn't know what to try, but the manager was sooooooo helpful he helped me order and was very attentive making sure that me and my girlfriends were satisfied. The service is quick and the restaurant was by far the cleanest place around.
One of the cleanest restaurants I have visited in a while.  Gyro was amazing and the service was great!

Me and the hubby got take out here for dinner. He got Mika ' s fries which were amazing and definitely worth 5.95! I got a falafel pita with side Greek salad. Both were yummy! Our total was just $15. Has a good atmosphere ans modern decor. We would totally go back again. Sad they don't have Greek lemon chicken soup though.
I love a good Gyro and this place makes them AMAZING! I ordered a traditional Gyro to go and was out the door in less than 5 minutes (good for my lunch break). I plan on going again for lunch today!
Great food! Great atmosphere! And great staff! 5 stars is an understatement. I would recommend this place to everyone!!! Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu!!

The jalapeño hummus was brilliant and they have delicious and authentic yellow basmati rice. The lemon Soup was rich and spicy. The only thing that could improve is the tzatziki sauce portion, it is very yummy but there is very little given, especially for the price of an individual side sauce. It would also be nice if the Greek fries came with tzatziki dip. Maybe they forgot to add it?   Great pita sandwiches, we had the beef Diablo and the chicken souvlaki. Have been here several times since it opened and have always had friendly and accommodating service.

My wife is greek. I love greek food. She is hyper critical of any greek fod beyond her own or her mothers. So I don't get to eat it very often, unless she cooks it. I finally convinced her to try this place. Granted it's fast greek. And some items on the menu are middle eastern, not really greek, but that's ok. The tzaziki, a true measure of any greek food, was surprisingly good. I was also impressed with the dolmades. The veggie gyro though needed a bit more feta to make the taste more authentic.  Overall, a good experience for greek food. There are plenty of options for all palates, including a kids menu.

Okay, just yes. Mikas is awesome, I love the modern update they made to the inside of the restaurant last year.   The food is so good!! I love the euro meat but the chicken is great too. Last night, I tried the Diablo wrap and it was the perfect amount of spicy. The Greek fries are an absolute must- fresh French fries with Greek dressing and feta cheese. I mean, feta cheese and French fries, obviously it's good.  The employees are friendly and it's quick and fresh. I really recommend! It's in the plaza off McDowell and sky song road. check it out!
This place overcharges for a very small portion of food I order a fries and a gyro the fries portion is very small and the gyro itself is small I order a drink and it came out to $14 not worth it

For a quick work lunch we decided to give Mika's a try.  I could not have been more pleased with our choice.  They have a very nice menu selection.  I ordered the gyro platter.  The food was fresh, flavorful, well seasoned and the right temperature.  We were 5 people and our food came out very quickly and all at about the same time.  I will definitely visit again the next time I travel to Scottsdale.

Great gyros! The meat is not dry and is flavorful. Their appetizers are delicious and great for sharing.   The place was clean and is usually not busy at all. Both times I went now.. The second time had a really grumpy looking server. The music playing was very odd. Will go if I'm in the area and in the mood but would not drive for it.
Definitely authentic and that is what I like most.  The food has that genequesa that just soothes the palate. Great comfort food.
Great value, great customer service, and great food.  I get the greek night club, add chicken!

Yummy greek food, really liked it! I was looking for a place near old town with not too pricey food and Mika's Greek sounded like a good option! My boyfriend is not too adventurous when it comes to food and trying new restaurants, but he liked this place a lot and told me he'd like to come back.  It's kind of in a weird location, we went at night and had a bit of trouble finding it right away. Also there was a person being arrested directly in front of Mika's Greek which freaked us out a bit! There weren't too many people inside, we didn't have to wait to order which was nice. I ended up getting the appetizer platter with extra falafel with no domaldes. I asked if I could get rice instead of domaldes but she said you can only really ask for more falafel. Wasn't too expensive, and was a large quantity of food! My boyfriend went for the chicken with fries (one meat one side) plate. It also came with pita and tzatziki. My platter had falafel, pita, hummus, and tzatziki. It was really good! The hummus had a great texture and flavor. Tzatziki was a bit too garlicky for me, left me with smelly breath, but it was good! The falafel had a good flavor to it, I liked it a lot. I'd be happy to come back!

I found Mika's on Yelp. I decided to try it out because people mentioned the large portions. I ordered the Greek Night Club with chicken souvlaki with the side salad. The side salad was normal size; however, the pita was packed with large pieces of chicken, lots of tztatziki, feta, and veggies. It was so big I had to ask for another pita. I love both of their ice teas. As an after thought I ordered a half order of falafel. They taste freshly made and had the perfect spice. Definitely worth the money. Friendly staff. They even brought the food to the table when I ordered at the counter. I would have given them 5 stars but they did charge for me to add Greek pickles to my pita and they will charge extra for tztatziki. All in all, excellent quality food and great service.

I should really write a review for this place since I eat here pretty much weekly for lunch. My coworkers and I have tried all the nearby gyro places and we all agree Mika's is the best. They even let me customize the Mediterranean like crazy (no tomato, no pickle, white pita, spicy tziki, spicy hummus). Our only gripe is we wish they made a chicken shawarma pita also, since we can't find a good one nearby and we know theirs would be the best. Very clean, nice digital menu boards and iPad registers, soothing new age music, and some of the best greek food in Tempe (especially for the price). Can't go wrong!
I've had better. Their chicken isn't the best but alright. I ordered their small platter. It's your typical Greek restaurant but to be honest I've had better Mediterranean food...
THA BOMB!!! Food was awesome, place was nice and clean, and to top it off the cashier/waiter was hot!

A perfect delight for a lunch spot. Just enough space to bring the whole crew. Atmosphere is excellent, staff is super friendly.. and wait for it.. wait for it... the FOOD was Great!   Had the gyro Caesar style with fries and hummus on the side.  The small staff here gives you a very family friendly vibe. Someone even asked throughout my meal if I was enjoying everything. Make me happy to see entrepreneurs doing a great job.

This is pretty decent fast-casual Greek food. It's clean and modern/simple looking inside, and the prices are fair. The only staff member I talked to seemed nice enough. It may not be one of my top Greek places in the valley, but I really have no complaints regarding my visit either.
I'm not an expert on greek food but I love this place. Good, quickservice and the gyros are just how i llike em.

What a joke these reviews with 5 stars are or family friends or members.  Decor nothing special except for I pads tje cashiers where using. Atmosphere well there was a cook using a blender which made it a unique back ground. Dolmas no flavor, greek fries are a joke, gyro was dry and old not even long  slices tazaki was tasteless greek salad was okay fries where soggy we where the only table in the restaurant. Our bill was over $35 for lunch there are way better greek restaurants and way more affordable in the area. For all of u that gave those 5 stars go try some other greek spots in the area then u will understand what I'm saying.
Went here for my first time and can't wait to come back. The food was great, and even better was the service. I was even given a free dessert for my first time! I highly recommend trying them out.
Mikas Greek definetly is one  of my favorite restaurants from now on , great service , excellent food, reasonable prices,  I strongly recomend this place everything is fresh very friendly staff.

I've walked past this many times during my treks from McFate Brewing to Papago Brewing.  It's always looked neat and clean so I decided to give them a try this week for lunch.  They have the usual assortment of Greek/Mediterranean menu items.  I went with a gyro with half gyro meat and half chicken with a side greek salad.  I also had an iced tea and I have to say that their iced tea is particularly good.  The food itself was excellent, plenty of meat and good tzatziki sauce.  They even take the pits out of the olives on the salad!  This place is neat as a pin, the food is good and the service is fast and friendly.
Made fresh. Good portions. Clean eating area. Favorite lunch spot Mom and I like to go.
Love the Diablo pita. Great portions. I recommend the Greek salad or rice as a side. This will become a regular stop for me.
An out of town friend and I stopped here today on our way to the Desert Botanical Gardens.  Clean Friendly Staff Quick Service Really Yummy Food!  Thanks!

Came to ups store next door and saw a sign with a chicken and hummus plate big with 4.95 on it went in ordered got charged 8 dollars then I asked why he said chicken is 3 dollars more. I get it's business but I hate bs advertising to get you in the store. Then charge me more for it.
Great fast Greek place. Food has always been great. Interior is fairly modern and very clean ad organized.

Just a snack for lunch...  I ordered the falafel dip with tzatziki. Service was very friendly and prompt. It was pre-lunch hour so it was empty. I ordered for take-out. It was quick.  Upon opening my order, the falafel were shaped like mini hockey pucks and were hard and much to salty, leading me to deduce that they were certainly of the frozen mass produced and bagged variety. The tzatziki tasted home made at least and was ok.  Cute place but not a great first experience.

I was in the area looking to kill sometime and grab a quick bite. When i stopped in and the place looked cute! Clean, nice staff, and the Menu looked pretty good.  i ordered the veggie souvlaki, and For $8 i would have expected more veggies than taziki sauce. It was basically dipping pita bread in taziki sauce and have maybe a small handful of chopped up veggies. I wont be coming back for the meal i had.

My wife, daughter and I were looking for some Greek type food, leaning toward healthy and tasty.  We saw the yelp reviews but were very disappointed.  I had the falafel pita with Greek salad.  The salad was ok, but the falafel were discs which seemed dry, overcooked and did not have much depth or flavor.  I am assuming these were frozen type not homemade.  My daughter ordered some chicken and she just got a plate of chicken pieces, no nothing with it, no greens, bread, zero with it.  My wife had a sampler plate of humus, grape leaves and pita. The grape leaves were very good but the rest was just ok.  The most annoying thing was that "fresh brewed icea tea" was on the menu.  Exactly what is desired on a hot day, but they do not have plain brewed ice tea for sale, only bottled teas.  The waitress taking our order was difficult to deal with.

just your average gyro spot, does not really do much to separate then from the other gyro spots code by, but its good and fresh, i will be back, and you can score a bogo on citi deals or verizon local deals.
Yum! So Fresh and delicious! The greekumbers were so delicious, I'm addicted! So good! We had two gyros with a Greek salad, the were tasty, very flavorful! Will definitely be going back!

Delicious hummus, I like both the traditional and jalapeño versions and the pita bread is soft and chewy but still holds up to scooping up hummus. The staff is friendly and it's perfect for picking up lunch on the go or to take back to the office.
Beautiful place, very modern and classic. Super sweet staff...Awesome hidden gem in this area:)
Delicious! Wasn't to fond of the service. Wasn't to busy and still had to wait 15 mins. Food was very good!

The food was alright and not very unique or memorable, however we called when it was NOT busy and still had our order messed up. The guy repeated the order back to us when we were ordering, but we still got the wrong food. I might try them again, but I was not satisfied enough to bring my business back or recommend them.

Food: Incredible! I got the 2 meat platter with gyro meat and falafel. It came with 2 sides, I chose Greek salad and red lentil soup. It also came with loads of pita bread and onions and tomatoes! So much food and flavor.   Atmosphere: Very clean and the interior decoration is very modern.   Service: Excellent. My gyro meat was shaved off the spinning chunk and everything else was made to order and in a timely manner. The man working was very friendly.   Price: Above par. For the amount you get in one order, it's well worth the price   I think I've found my new, favorite neighborhood Mediterranean place :)

Man I love this place not only cause the food is good but reasonably priced but not just that their staff is absolutely amazing compared to some of the other places around here these guys are super friendly super polite and it's always the same guys and you kind of develop some kind of feelings for this place

Within the past few months a slew of new lunch places have opened up by my work, one of them being Mika's Greek, so I was pretty excited to try them out.  When you 1st walk in, you think wow, what a cool looking place, its clean and modern, and has nice flat screen tv's on the wall, and when you pay you will notice their really isn't a cash register, it's like an ipad sort of thing, but I have to say its pretty cool.   Also the kitchen is opened, as you order can see them cooking the food, I like that.   I ordered the lunch special, I went with a chicken souvlaki pita which had sliced onions, tomatoes and tzatziki sauce and it came with a side order, and I chose fries.  The pita was nice and fresh, the chicken was tender and delish, great flavor, only down side to it was for me, there wasn't enough tzatziki sauce, but that's only because I really love that stuff! Haha   It was a great lunch time meal, look forward to coming back and trying out the rest f the menu.

Simply wonderful & delicious. Our first experience was great. The staff is friendly, the building is clean & modern and the food was delicious. We ordered the chicken platter and gyro platter- each come with two sides of your choice so we got 2 salads, rice and gyro fries for our sides! Yum!   If you're a big soda drinker, they have the Coca-Cola Freestyle drink machine with 100+ different sodas and flavor combos. I rarely order a drink and I had to get one just to try it. Vanilla Rootbeer and Vanilla Gingerale- yes please!   We just moved to this side of town and I can't wait to go back again :)

Good Greek restaurant for a strip mall.  Very clean and the food was very tasty. I had a gyro with a side of fries.  The fries were hot and crispy and gyro was stuffed with meat.  The meat was tender and flavorful.  The cost of $7.95 was good.  I will definitely come back and try something else

Liked the decor, but was ordering to go.  Very friendly, helpful staff.  Gyro was good.  Decent amount of meat and not too dry.  I like my gyro with more sauce and this sauce was pretty tasteless.  We didn't like the chicken gyro half as much as the regular...not enough flavor to the chicken and bland sauce.

Decided to stop by since my roommates brought some home the other night. Their gyros are huge and amazingly delicious. I also decided to try the Greek fries and was glad I got extra tzaziki sauce for those. That made them perfect. Last thing I ordered was the dolmades which were awesome as well. I use to go to George's Gyro's all the time but I think this might just be my new favorite. A definite plus that they're close by :)
I love this place. I had the gyro which comes with their greek fries and it was amazing. Everything was so fresh. I definitely intend to be a regular and check out the rest of their menu. Stay tuned.

I had grilled chicken on a skewer and the yellow basmati rice and lentil soup! I was wonderful and left overs at lunch the next day were just as delicious! Sampled some gyro meat, excellent!!!   I'm hesitant to eat lamb, it was actually very tasty and seasoned well, not gamey like I anticipated! I'll absolutely return!

This is a medium size greek restaurant on the side of Papago Plaza - I wish it was at a more visible location. This year they renovated their place and improved their menu.  I come here twice or thrice a week for lunch as it closest and best place to eat near my workplace.  Even though I prefer eating at home, it is not always feasible, so Mika comes to my rescue.  I do feel that their food has too much of sodium, atleast more than what should be there is a healthy food. I know that high sodium content in food is a problem all across US, but it doesn't hurt expecting from a place you eat out a lot.

Love this place! Tucked away and hidden in Papago Plaza by a barber shop. It is worth finding this gem. Love the Greek food. Not greasy at all and tastes delicious!! Very health conscious here and the restaurant is clean and cute.

I found this place on Yelp and I am so happy I did! I live right down the street and order takeout from Mika's pretty regularly.  I can't say enough about the food. it always tastes fresh and healthy! I love to get the Greekpeno Pita with jalapeno hummus and chicken. The falafel here is also amazing. Everyone I have taken here has enjoyed the food. Best part is that it's huge portions for a small price!

Got the mediterranean pita with chicken to go. It was delicious, and had a nice kick to it. Their tzatziki sauce is bangin'. My order only took a few minutes to make (granted it was 4 PM so I was the only one there). Service was fast & friendly. I'm surprised this place isn't busier nor has more reviews--it's really good and the rest of the menu looks great. I'll definitely be going back to try more.
They give you a lot of food! Vegetables are always really fresh and they don't put lettuce on their gyros  !!

So I traveled out of town and was craving for Greek food. I was in luck that there was a Greek restaurant near me. I checked the place out and it's a very clean and quiet establishment. I ordered their large platter just to fill my hunger from the order. I had the chicken souvlaki and gyro meat with a side of rice and salad. It also came with pita bread and veggies. Very delicious and filled me up! I also bought their jalapeño hummus which was very good. They have a coke dispensing machine that dispenses a variety of drinks from your usual sugary beverages to low calorie. I liked the place so much that I came back again after my run. I definitely recommend it. People are also friendly so that's a plus.
Very good portion size and very friendly customer service ! Food is very good also . Would defiantly recommend this place to friends !
This is a great place for a quick authentic Mediterranean style meal. The food tasted great, the staff was friendly, and most importantly the place was very clean. We will be back for sure!
Loved everything!! Had a Greek salad with gyro and about licked the plate. Best Gyros, best tzaziki and super clean. Awesome!

Had the greek chicken sandwich, fries and salad... I wish the fries where freshly cooked instead of out of a warmer... I'd go back in the future - not a bad lunch... Decent price sandwich was good salad just they way i like it.

Great food! Really fresh and tasty and a great deal for the money! Pita was loaded with meat. Yogurt sauce was amazing! Restaurant is clean and modern and even the bathrooms were spotless. I'd highly recommend eating here!

Very clean and inviting restaurant.  Had the Greek fries and Mediterranean gyro with gyro meat.  Food was hot and very tasty.  Good portions, couldn't even finish it all!   I love gyros and will definitely come back here to try other menu items.  The price was very good for the quality and the portion size.

Every time I walk into this place I know I'm going to have a great meal. This guy who runs the place (I'm assuming since he's always there) is extremely helpful and friendly. The food is always cooked to perfection and they bring your food out to you. They even check on you to make sure that everything is good. By far one of my favorite places to go. My kids love this place as well! My son's salad that you can see in the picture (he's one of the rare children in the world who loves salad and prefers it over anything) is always crisp and fresh. If you haven't tried this spot you are missing out!
Gyro plate was excellent.  Hummus plate was great. Wow do these pitas beat the crap out of pita jungle. Warm, fluffy, sweet even.  Very happy this resturant came to town.

Staying at a hotel around the corner, found Mika's on Yelp, saw positive rating, checked their website, liked the menu, stopped in, and boooooyeahhhhh!  I had the Greekpeño and fries.  Everything put together quickly from scratch, gyro meat was great, pickles and hummus and romaine all worked together perfectly, the pita didn't fall apart, it didn't leak all over the place (not that this is bad in a Greek/Middle Eastern sandwich, but maybe not if you're driving or on a date or something), and it was all delicious!  The fries too!  Will I go back for dinner 6 hours after lunch?!@?@!  Definitely maybe?  Will I take someone there the next time I'm in Phoenix?  For real!

Went here for lunch because we had a buy one get one free entree coupon. The food was good nothing special, I've had better Gyros before but with the coupon it was only 8 bucks for two of us to eat so it was a great deal. Maybe if I'm in the area again I'd come back
Great gyros good prices good service clean restaurant just there wasn't that many customers in there and I wondered why but great food

some of the best hummus i've had in a long time! the remodel (from the previous gyro restaurant) is gorgeous. no more of the ubiquitous blue & white "greek" theme. i also had a greek salad with chicken & it was delicious as well. i will go back for more.

AMAZING! Awesome staff. Food was fresh and delicious and fast. I am right up the street from this place and I am happy that I can walk here and get good foods. Mediterranean pita and Greek fries! Do it!

My boss got us to go food from Mika's, which we have named "Fake George's", only because they used to be named George's, but George's Famous is less than a block away, so they had to change. The interior was clean, with a few tables.   The menu had your normal Greek stuff, but was confusing to me. I wanted a falafel pita, but only saw falafel as a platter, but the lady said it was also a pita. The menu didn't reflect that, so I wonder what else I'm missing out on.  The falafel was different, but I liked it. Maybe nuts in it? Couldn't put my finger on it. It was cooked well, and was not over-sauced. The side salad I got to go with it was fresh, and I liked the dressing. My boss got the Gyro platter or salad with gyro meat...something like that. She loves it.  The food came out really quickly, and the counter service was friendly.

I've been here a hundred times, I'm surprised I haven't rated it yet!! The chicken is freshly grilled, the hummus is made with different, awesome seasonings. The baklava is really good and addictive, I could eat like 10 of those. And as a finale, other than the dolmades (my parents LOVED these) and their zesty salads, buy the Greek fries. Garlic will be running through your veins for a week.
Try the Mika's Fries. They were far better than what I expected. The restaurant was really nice and the staff was very friendly. My new spot.

I used to work near Mikas. Sad we moved this place was nice clean and great food. I drive from mesa to eat here. They have some of the best Gyros around. They will also package the meat sauce and fixings separate so you can assemble at home.
It's  if, McDonald's and Greek food had a baby. My rice was over done, the veggie wrap was mediocre.

This is a hidden gem!!!  Not only is the food amazing, but it's a great value, service is awesome and The dinning room lobby is top notch and squeaky clean!!!  I had the Picado with rice today and it was as great as any pita or gyro I have ever eaten. Just spicy enough with peppers and onions and excellent meat. It was assembled well  on a real plate and consumed with expertise! The yellow rice was fluffy, hot, and well seasoned, It's also addictive! I wants some more!!!!  Its a small locally owned chain, and I am lucky enough to have one so close to home.  Myka's past the ultimate test for me, it's CRAVABLE!!!!
Update for my previous review: they've ditched those Gold Peak tea dispensers and added 3 options of fresh brewed Passport Teas. Love it.

Amazing customer service. Very, very welcoming and the food was amazing. I am grieving the loss of a loved one and I had a breakdown while ordering, and the man working (who I think was the owner) was so understanding and nice to me, didn't make me feel stupid. He paid for my meal & the food was amazing. I would recommend this place to everyone based on the customer service alone. Thank you for being a small bright spot in my bad day.
Great Service - super nice guy at the counter. Gyro Meat - AMAZING! Lots of meet in the Pita Location - Good Atmophere- SO So  I would hit this place up for take out!

Love these guys. I've been there a few times and the food is great, the staff is amazing, and it's a good portion of food!   They even remembered my family and asked about them the next time I came in.  You guys go above and beyond in your service, we appreciate it!

Best place in the valley for a gyro or Greek salad. The gyro picado is my favorite. Always made perfectly, fresh and juicy. The restaurant is clean and the staff is always friendly. They have other locations which are equally great.

Walked in looking for something more delish than a regular cold sandwich.  This place is right next to Jimmy Johns - so I read a few reviews and thought I'd give it a try.  First off the place is spotless clean.  Large contemporary photographs grace the walls adding a modern air.  Customer service was polite and fast.  I ordered a couple Greek chicken pitas to go plus some hummus.  The chicken pita was delicious - totally loaded with flavorful meat and piping hot.  Highly recommend. :)

I ordered through Uber eats- which may have limited the menu or misrepresented it. But I ordered beef suvlaki. Souvlaki is supposed to be small pieces/cubes of meat. The "beef" souvlaki was ground beef pressed to look like steak- . Having lived in Greece and having grown up around "off the boat" Greeks- this place was a massive disappointment. The French fries were the run of the mill French fries (could've gone to a diner to get the same quality). The "beef" souvlaki was ground beef not cubes of beef- it was dry and I honestly couldn't eat it.   For the price I felt it was lacking significantly. The tzatziki sauce was OK - not good/not bad.  Disclaimer I'm from NY- new to AZ. Maybe it's the the area difference, maybe it is the Uber eats app misrepresenting the food? I don't like to leave reviews like this, but... it really was disappointing. I would've appreciated reading an honest review prior to ordering.

First time here. Went for a falafel platter. Got 3 brown disc looking things. Tried to take a bite of one and about chipped my tooth. Falafel should NOT be crunchy! Ever. Overly done and bad taste. Not sure what extra stuff they put in their falafel discs but good falafel does not need any "extra" stuff. Taziki sauce is ok. Rice is good but I didn't come in for rice.......
So amazing! Probably the closest thing to an authentic Greek gyro i have had since I moved back from Greece a year ago. Kalo!!

Great flavors, amazing selection!  Food: Mika's has a really good selection of "fast food Greek" fare. This was my first visit, and I honestly had a hard time choosing! I like that you can build your pita by selecting the toppings, the meat you want (or veggie), and the side. Did I mention they have a good selection? I was in the mood for something spicy, so I went with the DIABLO, which is tangy tzatziki, cucumber, tomatoes, and sriracha feta. For the meat I went traditional gyro meat, and for the side I went with the lemon garlic lentil soup. I was very pleased with my section! Everything was fresh and tasty, and the DIABLO was indeed spicy! I would get the same thing again, but there are so many choices...  :-)   Cost: $7.95 plus tax for my gyro and soup was very reasonable!  Service:  The staff was friendly, and my food was served quickly.  Atmosphere: Pretty good for a strip-mall style fast food restaurant. The seating is comfortable, lighting is good, and there are interesting photos on the walls. It's kept very clean, too!  Overall: Pleasant atmosphere, tasty food, and very nice selection. I'll be back!
Great food and service! This is the third greek place we have tried and for me it was the best. I love falafel..and whatever makes it green inside!

I love Mika's!  The food is always fresh and full of flavor.  My favorite thing about Mika's?  It is always IMMACULATE.  Not just the dining area...the kitchen too!   The glistening stainless steel is visible as soon as you walk through the door.  I am always confident that my food was prepared with food safety in mind, which is very important to me.   Tonight I am enjoying the hummus plate with tasty jalapeno hummus and delicious grilled chicken.  And a soft, warm pita of course!  Eating healthy never tasted so good! :)

I had gyro which was excellent. Not greasy and the best fresh Greek bread. I also loved the green tea I might have to start going there instead of QT for daily iced tea. Also love that you can get a salad as one of the sides.

Go there right now and get yourself Mika's fries. It's an unbelievable concoction of fries, with some sort of incredible Greek balsamic dressing, loaded with juicy delicious gyro meat, the world's best tzatziki sauce and feta cheese. I almost ate to the point of throwing up because it was so good.

I LOVE MIKA'S GREEK!! This place is located just a hop, skip, and jump away from where I work. This is by far the best place to get a gyro or a pita. My apologies to those other places who sell the same thing, there's a new sheriff in town and they blow you guys out of the water. The customer service is great. There is always a smile of their face, which makes a world of difference. They're really quick, so this works out great when you're pressed for time. I like to just call and order my food, very rarely does this take longer than 15 min. The Chicken Souvlaki Pita is AMAZING!! The chicken is never dry, it's always really tender and moist. I'm super happy they opened up. This place is great for lunch and dinner. You must come here and try it for yourselves!
The food is amazing. Staff is super friendly. Place is clean and really nice. Had the Greek sampler and a side of lamb. It was yummy.

This place is the real deal..  Went for lunch on a Saturday before Labor Day.  The place was pretty quiet.  Nice decor, very friendly staff, and the food was excellent.  Chicken served with Greek salad was fresh, juicy and perfectly grilled.  Greekumbers sounded goofy, but they tasted great - cucumbers, tzaziki and feta.  Surprisingly good...  Looking forward to the next visit!

Smells FANTASTIC! Taste as good as it smells too. Staff is so polite and helpful too.  Good size portions.  Soup is delicious and I recall saying I could eat just the soup and be satisfied. I like the soda machine with its numerous options.  Sometimes, a lot lately, I want the effervescence of a soda but without the artificial colors, flavors, and toxic sweeteners/calories = soda water.  They have that here.   Booths are spacious.  Decor is clean and simple, maybe what could be classified as minimalist.  Colors are mellow.  I like the menu boards.  The font is easy to read and the colors on the gray black background help keep it legible. And of course, the menu options are yummy. I've tried a couple of things like pita with gyro meat or beef slouvaki.  The hummus is good and the Baklava is tasty too, but I can tell that it's mass produced.  Here's me, soup and the sparkling water and I'm good to go.

What I love about this place is the cleanliness, extensive yet simple menu, friendly staff, speediness, and the great location!   I've been here quite a few times now for lunch and each time I have yet to be disappointed. The menu may look a little overwhelming at first but the staff are great at explaining the items and what you can do to custom items or substitute on your plates.   Every time I go I always have the original gyro plate which comes with fries but I substitute for their yellow Greek rice. White tzaziki sauce, onions and tomatoes come on it, however I leave the tomatoes out. I will have to try all the other delicious looking items on their menu next time.   My friends ordered the chicken gyro with fries. I taste a little of the chicken and it was amazing! For those that like gluten free, there's quite a few items on the menu to choose from!  Great place! Fast and friendly service!!!

All of the dishes have so much flavor! Service is quick and the place is spotless. Try the Mikas Fries if you are feeling adventurous. I love the modern feel of Mikas and if you like Siracha, you will be in heaven.

Mika's greek has the bestt food in the valley with 4 locations to serve you today i came to the one in downtown phx and we ordered the mikas platter with mikas fries uggg they were soo good me and my husband have been eating here for 3 yrs and the food is always fresh and delicious the staff is amazing and the owner don is the bestt and nicest guy so if your looking for a quick stop for some delicious food come to mikas greek - G and Jehona
Great new little Greek food place. I had the "Pica" gyro which was nice and spicy with jalapeños.   Service was fast and the quality was excellent. Place is clean and new and upscale. Great find!

Soooooooooooooooo fire . I've been looking for a gyro spot near downtown and I've found it. The jalapeño hummus is so good too. I really like how they have the gyro on the spit and they shave your gyro off and cook it to your liking. So flame I'll be back FOR SURE

Eat here all the time. Great food and great management/owners. Not sure who's working tonight but when I ordered rice her excuse was "we're closing no more rice" it's 8:40. You don't close for 20 minutes. I drove 20 min to get late night carbs.   Great place but being 20 minutes from closing isn't an excuse for the most important part of my meal.

I had Mika's large platter with gyro, salad and rice! I didn't care for the rice, but the gyro meat was good, and they were definitely not cheap about the meat AND I LOVED THE SALAD.  Would definitely come back.
We were visiting Scottsdale for A few days we found this Greek restaurant. It is awesome excellent food great value would come back again and again and again

This place rocks. Fresh, yummy and perfect flavors. The chicken pita  is delicious with just the right amount of tzatziki. The fries are fried to perfection. I just got the lentil soup and it is a burst of flavor. Very surprising. The restaurant is clean and inviting. Prices are very affordable. I recommend this place.

When you check in to an establishment and reach Duchess status you probably owe them a review. Honestly, I owed Mika's a review a long time ago. As a lover of Greek food and falafels this is my go-to lunch place. It also is incredibly clean and uses super fresh ingredients. I'll eat Greek food from almost anywhere, but lots of places can have very greasy dishes. Not here. Lots of grilling, minimal oil usage (even in fried items like the falafel) and the presentation is on point. You pay for quality here but they certainly deliver it.

Yum! I've been on a Greek food kick and when I needed some falafel for lunch last week this hit the spot. Try the rice!   The place is new, clean, and they have a large menu. I just remember being shocked by the price - it's sort of fast food, the prices just seemed high.  Bonus - they keep LOTS of Sriracha bottles around!

I loved this little Greek place! Definitely off the beaten path, but clean, modern and the food was delicious. I had the gyro platter with fries and shared a baklava for dessert. The gyro was a bit different than I expected- pita triangles served alongside the meat and toppings instead of a pre-made gyro - but so delicious that I ate more than I should have. Baklava is not my favorite, but this version was great. I'll definitely be back!
I am a regular. I'm obsessed with the greek salad with chicken. The food is always fresh and made right in front of you. I always feel good after having a meal at Mika's Greek.

Its either the grilled chicken or gyro Diablo that I go with and the lentil soup! You cant beat the price and the quality. Friendly staff, quick service, and most of all amazing food! You cant go wrong with this place!

Place is clean, and open air concept.  Staff was friendly.  My only issue really here was the price and size of the dishes.  I don't have a problem with dishing out 13 dollars a plate if the size is substantial or the food is amazing, neither was the case here.  For two people, with out drinks, two "large size" entrees, a appetizer, and tip, 50 bucks. Still left a little hungry, .  Sorry, won't be returning.

Mika's Greek 780 W. Elliot Road Tempe 85284  A group of us descended on Mika's for dinner. The restaurant is small, sparsely decorated, but immaculately clean. Orders are taken at a main counter, then is brought to your table for you.  Our group ordered an assortment of items so that we could all try them.   First was falafel. Nicely cooked and properly seasoned, one could tell they were fresh because they were green instead of brown inside.   The Mika's fries were a real treat and reminded me of nacho's in that they were topped with gyro meat, feta cheese, a house dressing and tzatiziki sauce. This was a mouth full of flavor. Chicken souvlaki was tender and moist and the dolma's were perfection.   The grilled Greek chicken served on a platter was marinated in olive oil and garlic and was cooked just right. I got mine with rice and salad as well as fresh warm pitas.   A member of our party was a vegetarian, and was not disappointed in all the selection on the menu.   The restaurant only serves soft drinks, but that was not a drawback. Desserts were on the menu, but no one had any room left to try them.  Prices range from $7.95 to $12.95 and portions were of a good size for most anyone. Service was nice and friendly, and the cleanliness was a true standout.  I give the restaurant 4 stars

Rough morning? Rough week? Rough MONTH? (We won't go there) Forgot your lunch?   Mika's Greek to the rescue! Been meaning to pop over here for a while now.  In search of something protein loaded / semi-healthy to fuel a workout, I got out of my office (and perhaps get out of my funk) and drove over to Mika's.   First of all, it's extremely clean and modern inside. No frills decor, screens overhead detailing the menu and iPad registers.   Very nice gal who took my order. I got the Chicken Souvlaki Pita combo with a salad. $7.95. No drink, but there's a Coke Freestyle machine here.   Food came out in about 15 minutes, piping hot.   Pst, secret's out: If you get there at or around 11, you'll get your food quickly before the lunch crowd arrives.   Generous portion of juicy, well marinated chicken with tomatoes, red onion and tzatziki sauce enveloped in what seemed to be a grilled pita.   While it was delicious and filling, the tzatziki sauce was lacking depth in flavor. Where was the lemon, garlic and dill? All I was tasting was yogurt and salt and pepper. :(   The salad had all the characteristics of a typical Greek salad: Cucumber, tomatoes, onions, kalamata olives, sprinkle of feta cheese and a pepperoncini.  What I loved about it? The dressing!   It was oil based, not creamy ranch like stuff like that one Greek place. Next time I'll get it on the side though, as whoever prepped the salad went cookoo bananas with the dressing.   3.5 Stars: Nothing mind blowing here like my friends made it out to be.  Hoping this was just an off day with the Tzatziki because everything else was delicious.   I will definitely return to Mika's Greek to try their Original Gyro, with Andrew C. -  And perhaps up this rating!

It's GREAT Gyros, best around the restaurant is immaculate, etc.  Dito for all the reviews but someone needs to mention that they definitely "don't put enough of their tziki sauce on their gyros.  That is consistent we go there all the time and mention to them they always make you purchase another...
Great food! Awesome service! But above all, one of the cleanest restaurants I've ever been to. I would recommend this restaurant in a heart beat.

Mika's serves up quick, fresh, flavorful Greek food that you can take to go or eat in.  All food is made fresh to order.  The wait time for your food is normally 2-5 minutes depending on what you get, but when in rush, you can call an order in ahead of time.  They make everything from salads to gyros to full meals.  The prices are reasonable.  Its a great place for lunch or a simple dinner.  The restaurant is well maintained, modern, and very comfortable, but not easily spotted from N. Scottsdale Road.  They also offer free Wi-Fi.  This is my "go-to" place for something quick, tasty, and fairly healthy.  Check it out!
Greek salad with gyro was fresh and tasty.  Got it to-go.  Was prepared quickly.  Restaurant was clean and staff are friendly.
I love the gyro pita at Mika's. I have always been tempted to order pizza but I always come back to the gyro. My wife typically gets the greek salad with chicken and she is never dissapointed.
One of my favorite places to go for lunch/early dinner. I get the $7.50 combo with lamb gyro and salad. The lamb is so tender it melts in your mouth. Wonderful!! The people are great who work here.
First time here - was great! Hummus was awesome, food was great. Excellent service too - will be back.

Great and very fresh fast food. I had a grilled chicken plate. The chicken is very tender and moist. Had a yummy Greek side salad with plenty of feta olives and chopped cucumber. Just visiting town or I'd become a regular
One of the better hummuses I've had in AZ and the gyros are delicious. The prices are reasonable as well.

I stepped inside to get a to-go order and was impressed by the contemporary chic feel of this place, just like the decor at the other location on Elliot. The menu has all your Mediterranean style favorites, with a twist of Southwestern elements such as their jalapeno hummus. I got the Greekpeno pita to go with a Caesar salad.   My order was ready in a speedy amount of time and nicely packaged. When I opened up the package, my pita was filled with 3 tasty looking falafel, greens, pickles, tomatoes and jalapeno hummus. It was a pretty enjoyable lunch. The bread was fluffy and soft, and all the elements worked well together. The falafel was crisp and well seasoned. I also liked the slight hint of spiciness from the jalapeno hummus. While I still have a favorite hummus and falafel at another restaurant their rendition here was overall good.  Service was great. The cashier was very kind and friendly. I also got a few recommendations on what to get at DaYung's next time I go there haha (Try the tomato smoothie he says).  Overall, you can't go wrong with great service and delicious pita sandwiches!  4.25/5

Quite possibly the best gyro I've had in Arizona! Mika's serves up reasonably priced meals with high quality, very fresh ingredients. We came here with a Groupon and were pleasantly surprised by the quality, portions, and atmosphere of this cute little Greek eatery.  Our Groupon included 2 pitas and 2 fountain drinks. We decided on the Mediterranean chicken and a gyro picado. Each pita comes with a side (Fries, soup, salad, or rice). We chose rice and soup as ours.  The gyro meat was tender, with well balanced flavors in the pita itself. There was a lot of meat and veggies inside, which made the pita a great deal since it also included a side. I loved that they had a unique twist on the classic gyro pita, adding jalapeno to the mix to add some spicy kick. The lentil soup I had was quite good. It had the right amount of spice, and was filling and hearty. The Mediterranean chicken pita was also very good, with tender, juicy chunks of chicken. The pitas themselves were soft, slightly grilled, and came with the option of regular or wheat. I tried both types, and they were both equally good. As for the side of rice, it was well seasoned, with a nice fluffy texture.  Fountain drinks are free-range, and there's also a tea station with several options of tea available. Sodas are Coca-Cola brand products.   The atmosphere had a nice modern feel, very unlike other Greek places I've been to where they have a slightly outdated look, accentuated by those cheesy "GYROS" posters that look like they're from the '70s and '80s, of a young lady brandishing a gyro.  This restaurant is definite gem of a find through Groupon. Go here if you want delicious Greek food!

What a great lunch! I got the gyro with rice and it was really good. It tasted fresh and the rice was full of flavor, and the service was amazing! The gentleman who took my order was very sweet, brought me my food and even got my utensils when I forgot to get them myself.  I wasn't sure how packed it was going to be because I went on my lunch break (at 1pm) but it wasn't packed at all and my experience was great!

I was impressed. Their falafel and gyro were amazing. Their Dolmeh was a bit cold and their Greek fries had too much feta. I hope they also fix their ice machine.   For some reason this place reminds me of chipotle... Which is a good thing. Overall I was full and satisfied.

Went here after a couple of months. The place is now almost 2-3 times bigger. Very clean. The waiters are very nice and orders come up really fast. Ordered the falafel pita sandwich and it was really good. Would definitely recommend this for a quick greek lunch :)
Got a greek salad with gyro meat. Meat was moist and the portion was big.  Can't wait to check out more of the menu

So much cleaner than all those grimy mom & pop Greek spots. Mika's is clean and modern. Lots of choices of meat, 2 kinds of chicken and beef, along with Lamb (gyro meat). It makes me happy that they have the coke machine with the hundred choice. I get the Greek salad with gyro meat. It's big with feta and red wine vinegar based dressing. It comes with a grilled pita on the side.
Excellent food and service. Daniel is awesome and always remembers my preferences. Atmosphere is clean  and well done.
Unbelievable Gyro. First time here but plan on coming back many more times. Wasn't happy that my buddy was charged $.75 for more sauce for his Gyro. Staff very nice.
Amazing food, lovely modern atmosphere, and great service. Love the classic gyro. Also have Great desserts, recommend highly.

Ordered for take out again and have to up the rating. The gyro meat was so incredibly flavored and tender I can't wait to try it again.   The hummos was creamy and the falafel had just the right amount of spice. I ordered the gyro Mediterranean style and the pickle and tahini rocked. This is now in our regular rotation for take out.

I have not been the biggest fan of Greek food restaurants in tempe or phoenix . generally the food tastes dry and old like its been sitting out all day or they don't give you enough meat however this place was very refreshing not only did they load up the meat the rice was fresh and everything tastes like it was just made very moist and delicious will definitely be going here again soon

Met a gf here for lunch. What a delight. The place smelled like fresh cut cucumber. You order in line and then sit. They bring the food out to you. I ordered a hummus duo and Greek salad. The hummus was delicious. The salad was fresh and perfectly zesty!  The restaurant quickly filled up and I realized that many people already know about this gem in south Scottsdale. I'll be back.

The Greek salad was excellent here! The tahini and feta was awesome and I've been to Greece and this food was very good. The owner was very nice and described how the food was made and what was in the ingredients. We sat outside on a lovely patio area. A nice lunch spot in Tempe!

I ordered to go. There was spit ontop of my soup. I had to go back and get a new one. Who is spitting in peoples food and why? They need a health inspector in there stat.  I will report this. They werent even apologetic.
Love the redesign inside! Food was great. Me & my sister split the Greek salad, Mika fries & baklava sundae. Food came out quickly and was delish!! I'll be back...

Very good food, large portions, and good selection. I came with a family of five, and everyone loved it. Most people ordered their food to go, but we dined in. The restaurant was clean and nicely updated. The woman behind the counter was polite, served our food, and cleared our places, which was a nice surprise.

Pros: the place is spotless and the service was GREAT. Prices are reasonable and the foods made fresh to order.  Cons: The food was absolutely flavorless. I rarely need to add salt to my food but it was needed on every item. Chicken was bland and the rice was terrible. The best part of the meal was the pita.  Nice place with a great staff but the food was average at best.  I wouldn't return on my own but if someone insisted on going I'd be ok with it.

LOVE living so close to this quick lunch/dinner spot!  The greekpeno with falafel is my go to every time! Fast friendly service and the place always looks nice and tidy.  Also, their pita is delicious!

Not the best Greek I've ever had but sufficient for a quick lunch. I like the open kitchen concept. Service is pretty fast and the portions are slightly larger than average.Every time I eat here the restaurant is extremely clean. My only real complaint  is that the pita sandwiches are often oozing with oil by the time you reach the last bite. Also, they do not offer lunch combos and a gyro, fries and soda will cost you almost $11...The new Coke Freestyle machine almost makes it worth it. I usually eat here once a week during the lunch hour.

Pulled up to this restaurant by chance. I read the exceptional reviews and thought this sounds good!!!  Delicious food, amazing interior, friendly staff. I took pictures of the restaurant itself.  VERY NICE.  They do not offer wiFi but they have plenty of charging stations if you want to use your computer or tablet.   I'll be back.
Love this place! This is the second location I have visited and both had great  food and service.   Reasonable prices and large portions.  This is definitely my go to place for gyros.

Great place for a quick lunch or dinner.  Gyro was done right and Greek fries were good. Nice prices and plenty of options to customize it the way you want. Friendly staff makes for a welcoming atmosphere.
Great Greek food. The gyro platter was delicious, meat was tender and well seasoned, great salad and the lentil soup was tasty.  Definitely a new central phx favorite. Must try

Seemingly endless customization options set Mika's apart from other Greek lunch locations.  First, choose what you want in your pita. There's the traditional gyro meat, but also beef souvlaki, chicken, falafel, and more. Then, choose from a few styles. I thought the original was only so-so, but the Picado, with jalapenos, onions, and peppers grilled with the gyro meat, was a fantastic change of pace. Pair whatever you get with a salad, as the fries are honestly kinda lame.   Gosh, I'm not gonna rave about this place, but it's edible Greek made fast. Come here when you're on the go.

Three of us went at 5pm Saturday before Valentine's Day.  We wanted a place that wouldn't be inundated with celebrants, one that was a locally owned one and someplace we haven't been before.  Mika's Greek fit the bill perfectly!               First impression:  just like so many Yelp reviews, it was hard to find.  I thought there was a Mediterranean place on the west side of the plaza... nope... there was a pizza place that has a huge ad for GYROS in the front window.  That was misleading.  The man there, helped us when we asked where Mika's was and he kindly pointed.  We will have to stop there for pizza sometime, since he did help us find it.  Mika's is on the south part of Papago Plaza, next to the British Pub.      Second impression:   CLEAN!  It was a crisp clean interior design and modern.  I really liked it.      Next:  We were to order at the front  counter and they would bring it to us.  A little awkward with one of us with a cane, and having never been there... but we were just new to the place.... next time will be easy peasy.        Next:   WOWOWOWOW the food was great!  We ordered the Greek Sampler and my favorite part was the hummus, tzatziki and pita.  Very quickly after that, our entrees arrived.  Each of us had ordered pitas.  The chicken caesar pita was said to have really tender delicious chicken... the Original pita was yummy with extra tzatziki... and the Diablo pita was very much enjoyed by our friend.  The pitas come with a side.   Our choices of rice and salad worked very well with our pitas.      Desert was very very tempting, but with having had the sampler before the meal, we look forward to having the honey walnut baklava another time.   I would highly recommend going.
Fast, Reasonably priced, Delicious! i always go with the Mediterranean pita with gyro meat, and the greek salad, never disappointing!
It was okay. I kind of had higher expectations for this place place based on  some of the reviews but for me it was just OK. The prices are reasonable the location is good there's ample parking.

Everything we've had here, over several different visits, has been really great - fresh, and very tasty.  I love Greek food, and for a quick/casual restaurant, Mika's hits the spot.  The restaurant is modern, clean, and very pleasant. The staff is always super nice.  Have absolutely no complaints, and am actually headed there again tonight, to grab a quick bite with my husband!

I have had my share of a Greek food and this is amazing!  Fresh, flavorful and affordable.   If you are in Scottsdale you must check them out.  Indoor and outdoor seating is a plus, and it's not loud inside at all.

Love love love it!!!!  I have never been here and had anything that I haven't liked. They are really fast which makes going here on your lunch break easy. I usually order take out and I get a text 10 min later that my order is ready.

This location has been many different restaurants over the years - this is a tough spot. This is my favorite thing it's been though.   The food is great here and the owner is cool. The prices are really reasonable and the portions are large. The place is really clean and the decor is nice. Everything is cooked in plain sight, so there's no mystery.   My only complaint would be that he doesn't deliver yet. We definitely need a good gyro place that delivers in the area.  Seriously though - the food is really delicious. If you like flavors - it's all really flavorful. Great hummus too. Try the pizza puff.
Great place, good food, friendly and fast service!  However, needs some daily specials like Mika's Monday......or let us use the entertainment book coupon more then once.

Literally searched for "food" and this restaurant came up, a good Gyro can be hard to find. Seriously delicious, really quick service, it's hot,  fresh,  great beef & lamb, pita, lots of it. Price is good!

This place is expensive enough to afford air conditioning. So came in ordered food, ordered a drink but was told the soda machine was out but tea was still an option... Ordered a tea, ice machine is broken, all I get is a sorry, not even an offer for a refund... So now I'm sitting here drinking hot iced tea with no air conditioning waiting on my food. I WILL NOT be back here.

I found this place on Yelp and have only been here for lunch on week days. They are pretty speedy I can usually get in and out within 30 to 35 mintues. Out of the dozen or so times I have been here the food has always been great.   The best part is no matter what I order I always get the portions, taste and great food. It's awesome. I strongly recommend you try this place out you won't regret it! Their beef is to die for!
This might be our new spot for grocery shopping nights! Wow! Loved the food! Very modern, sophisticated, and clean restaurant! Very impressed! "I'll be back!" - Arnold
Love this place, great food and even faster service. I've been going here for awhile because I work right across the street at a tech company.

FYI Grub hub increases the price for each item noticeably. I'd suggest not using Grub hub and just calling the restaurant directly if you want to place an order.  Been here three times so far and every time has been a good experience. Good food, good prices, portion sizes are great (the large plate is a ridiculous amount of food for the money), service was fast and polite, there are plenty of ways to order and you can dine in or takeout. Highly recommend for a tasty quick bite that will fill you up without emptying the wallet.
Awesome food, atmosphere and management! I had the Greek Sampler and the hummus (plain and jalapeño), dolmades and falafel were so flavorful and fresh! Yummmmm.....  Will definitely come back.
Best Greek food I've had thus far! I get it all the time! Love the jalapeño cilantro hummus and the chicken skewers.

I got charged TWICE by them and when I brought this to their attention, I was told that their manager wasnt in to perform a refund (LOL) and that my refund would be done the following monday.  It has been 3 weeks and I have yet to see that $25 they owe me.

Really good Greek food that I really enjoyed. The falafel was well seasoned and so tasty. Fresh vegetables, pita and these amazing Greek fries with feta cheese and Greek dressing that I really dug.   The staff were so friendly and the place is really clean.
Best gyro meat I've ever tasted, plus the owner has an infectious smile!

The girl taking my order didn't know what a simple "gyro & fry" combo meant. Not the brightest crayon in the box....so good luck ordering. After I ordered I heard her complain to another worker & they both glared in my direction. Worst "customer service" I've ever experienced. I ended up having them refund my order....it was that bad. Stay away from this place. I'm surprised they're still in business.

I really enjoyed.  The classic pita has great beef/lamb with red onion and tomato.  My young son wanted no onion nor tomato and they easily accommodated.   They have several other choices of pitas.  Including jalapeno and a Sriracha which I want to try on future visits. Numerous other items on the menu.  Side of humas good, side salad excellent.  It Mika'd my day.  Nice gyros!  Wonderful staff!
Best Gyro I've had in years.  Tatziki (sp?) is PHENOMENAL.  I wish they sold it in jars.

It was pretty late and I was craving a gyro sandwich so I googled Greek and Mika's came up! They are open till 9 which was really cool and the inside of the store is so inviting. The man behind the counter was friendly and quick! I ordered a gyro sandwich and it was delicious, the lamb was sliced thinly and they give you a generous portion~ I had a great experience!

GIVE ME MOREEEEEE.  Okay this place is glorious. My boyfriend and I bought a groupon to try it out which included a pita of your choice with a drink and a side. Awesome. I also had to get the hummus sampler because I loooove hummus. I was so stoked when our food came out because the portions are nice and big, the fries looked fresh and crispy, hummus and my lentil soup looked delicious. Thankfully I was starving that day, otherwise I would not have been able to finish my meal. It was one of the best pitas I have ever had. Fries, hummus and soup were divine. Service was perfect. The man who is there often is very nice and even nicer to look at, hahaha. I love this place! Try it!
This place is awesome! Delicious food and friendly, professional service.  Love love love the garlic lemon lentil soup. And the baklava--yummy!

Came for lunch on the recommendation of a friend.  The restaurant is very clean.  The food was fresh and enjoyable.  We tried several items.  I would suggest order your favorite Greek food item and you will most likely enjoy it.  We will definitely come back again.

UPDATE: DO NOT ORDER THRU YELP!!!! THEY CHARGE AN ADDITIONAL $3 PER ITEM TO THE ORDER JUST FOR USING THE WEBSITE!!! CALL YOUR ORDER IN!!! RESTAURANT CHARGES $8.95 for the wraps and yelp or Grubhub charges $11.95!!! So bomb! Super fresh and fast! I had a chicken Caesar pita with side Greek salad and the dressing is delicious!! Added a drink and spent $11 out the door. In a plaza so can easily drive past it but it's worth the extra look!! Consider me a regular

First of all... Mika's Fries were amazing. You HAVE to order them. We ordered them with gyro instead of chicken. My boyfriend and I were able to share 1 plate and were full by the end. The fries are topped with a lemon-y balsamic vinaigrette, a tzatziki sauce, and gyro. Every component of the dish was flavorful- the fries were hot and fresh, the vinaigrette had the perfect amount of lemon, the tzatziki was refreshing, and the gyro was so good. Definitely recommend. I need to go back and try something else on the menu!!

This place was soon good I thought no place would make a better Gyro the Pita Jungle so glad to see I was wrong. It may be a little tucked away but once you find it you will be glad that you did. The lady at the counter was so nice and informative and on a plus didn't try to shave information at us or try to over sell something.

I am surprised I haven't reviewed this place yet, as many times as I come here! This is a long overdue review!   Hands down, this place is amazing! The ambiance of the restaurant, with its cool Mediterranean music and vibes, pulls you in to sit down and stay awhile! The smell of sizzling gyro meat, filling the air and luring you in for a taste! The crispy hot french fries, pairing so perfectly with their (seemingly) endless ketchup supply, is enough to keep you hooked for good! Okay, so now that I sound like the Mika's addict that I am, let me convince you just how awesome they are!    Their customer service, nothing short of perfect! Consistently sweet, consistently welcoming, consistently great service. These guys are super fast too! I usually call ahead to come pick up my order, and within 5-10 minutes, it's there waiting for me! I've never had to wait longer than 10 minutes for my order.   The food is downright delicious. HUGE portions, served fresh and hot! I tend to shy away from dairy, (as it sadly doesn't agree much with my tummy!), but their Tatziki sauce is something I can actually eat, and brag about! It's a MUST try! It's just so yummy and flavorful! It really brings the classic gyro together, in my opinion!  Another plus, for all you soda lovers out there, a fancy Coke machine that lets you pick and choose different flavors for your plain ol' soda, making it a customizable delight!

This place has lost me as a customer. I was eating here for lunch about once a week until they recently changed the menu.  Replacing gyros with wraps is a bad move.  If I want a wrap, I'll go to a sandwich place.  If I want a gyro, I'll go to a Greek restaurant.  But since the gyros are off the menu, I don't consider Mika's a Greek restaurant any more.  And even with the conversion to wraps, they eliminated my usual Greek Night Club. Good bye.

Walking in, the restaurant is clean and well organized. The employees are very helpful with explaining dishes, especially is Greek is new to you. I love the fact that the kitchen is wide open. You can tell they take pride in their work, and the spotless kitchen exemplifies that.   Food is quick- by the time I got my soda from that really cool touchscreen soda fountain, my food was already done.  I order the regular pita with gyro meat, and a Greek salad. The salad was great- it had just enough dressing on it without being overpowering. The onions, tomatoes, and lettuce tasted freshly cut.   The pita was hot and fresh, and the tzatziki sauce was awesome! Everything tasted hot and fresh. The portions are adequate- not gut busting Chipotle burrito size, but the pita was plenty of food for a lunch on it's own.  Overall, this has been my favorite go-to for Greek, and I'll definitely be back.
Incredibly clean place. The food was great one of the best Greek places in the area. Will eat here again and it's not to expensive.

Loved this place for lunch! The gyro meat was SO delicious and perfectly tender and moist (at every other greek place I've ever been to, it's always too dry and I have to smother it in tzatziki). I got the smaller plate option with gyro meat, and great price and portion size. My only complaint was the tomatoes--pinkish and definitely not at their peak. It seems to be a standard in the restaurant industry, but I don't understand why people use out-of-season tomatoes. I suppose, sadly, that's all some people know, but there are some types of produce that should only be used at their peak. However, my love of the gyro meat was so great, that it outweighed the tomatoes, and led to five stars.

The food was meh.  In my opinion it is very overpriced.  I ordered a an oreo cheesecake dessert and it took like 15 minutes to get and was something very old that seemed like they dug out of the bottom of a freezer.
Service and food is always great. The quality of their ingredients are great for Greek food. The salad is one of the freshest I've had from any Greek restaurant.

Excellent service and really really good food! What a refreshing surprise to find a gem like this. They care about their food and you . Decor is nice and clean. Owner operated so you know he cares. My new favorite restraunt in Tempe!

Awesome little Greek place!! I just moved in across the street & scored with this being my favorite food! I could live on hummus and theirs ROCKS!! The jalapeño hummus is superb! Best I've ever tasted & plain is excellent but has lots of garlic. Which is good for some & some not... I loved it!! Falafel is obviously homemade vs. Pasty mix. To go order was fast, easy & Christian gave great friendly reception!! Inside very nice, clean cut & a bit above average strip mall casual! Outdoor seating available. I'll be a regular...  Check them out!!  I would give 5 stars if they had Babaganoush!!

I tried this place for the first time last night, and man was I pleasantly surprised. I got the gyropeno and definitely was full after. They gave a generous portion of gyro meat as well as sauces. We took it to go, but the restaurant was very clean when we picked it up. The girl who rang us up was super nice and made small talk while I waited. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu :)

Solid Greek food. Definitely better then a lot of the other Greek places around, probably the best I've had in central Phoenix (which isn't necessarily a complement). We live in the neighborhood so we were excited when this place opened up. They have obviously put some money into this place, taking down a couple of walls and completely remodeling the interior.   Food was good. Good tzatziki sauce, good meat on the gyro, overall pretty good. Fry's were good, not spectacular, but good. We hope this place has a chance to stick around for a while in this difficult spot, the neighborhood will be thankful to have good Greek food nearby.
Stopped here for lunch with my wife - really good food, cool interior, clean - will definitely go back.

We've been coming to this restaurant for over a year now so we're regulars. We're regulars because they ALWAYS do an amazing job! We love the staff especially the cashier and cook who always greets us and are very personable. The food is delicious! We get the platters to share or Mika's pita. Greekpeño is my fave but my gf loves the original. We've made a goal to eventually try everything but we definitely have our favorites. This is one of the best restaurants to get something fresh, delicious and healthy! I promise!

I was pretty disappointed in this place. :( I'm a huge greek food fan, and Mika's really missed the mark. We don't have many options in cen-pho, so I was hopeful Mika's would fit the niche we need...   The atmosphere: nice, I guess. It's a little odd.. almost too formal-type décor in a fast food setting. They clearly put some money and effort into renovations though, and I can appreciate that. One issue is space, and how there isn't much of it. They must do a lot of take out business because there were several groups of people waiting around for their food (read: blocking the soda fountain.)   The service: It's fast food style. You order at a counter and get a number, the food is brought out to you. The girl at the counter was nice. The time it took to get our food seemed unreasonably long. :/ eh.   The food: I fully admit that I am pregnant and will typically eat anything. I have a ravenous appetite and it doesn't take much pomp and circumstance to please me... But I was disappointed. I can only imagine the feelings of someone who isn't eating for two.   I ordered The Mediterranean chicken pita with their upgraded "greek fries" (fries with oil, seasonings, and feta on top) As soon as our food arrived I was disappointed by the obvious freezer fries. And the addition of a LOT of olive oil wasn't doing them any favors. Those little freezer fries soaked up that oil like a sponge. I like the idea of these toppings on fries, but you REALLY need to use fresh cut shoestring or thinner fries, not frozen steak fries.   The pita was just ok. The chicken was juicy (an upgrade from Athenian Express' dry chicken) but the flavor wasn't fantastic. It was amply filled, pita was fine. (might just be bagged and warmed though, didn't taste house-made) I will give them credit for the tzasiki sauce. It did taste authentic and homemade and I enjoyed it.   My husband ordered the chicken souvlaki (simply just chicken on skewers) and had the lentil soup side. The soup tasted canned. It was bland and the texre left much to be desired.
