The chicken skewers were literally just like, 8 chicken balls on a skewer with some greek seasoning sprinkled on and grilled. Hubby said they were not amazing. Just "sort of green tasting dry-ish chicken on a stick."   I should probably mention the soda/fountain issues. :/ The ice dispenser wasn't working, so you have to get ice from the counter. Whatever. I got a sprite, and the soda is coming out of the fountain warm or something.. It was very weird. Much of the ice given to me was melty immediately, rendering the soda watered down and less than carbonated. Thinking initially that maybe the syrup was low on that one I replaced it with the Dr. Pepper (after getting more ice from the counter), and nope. That soda had to have been warm too, it caused the same issue. This probably wouldn't bother everyone, but I'm a connoisseur of fountain soda, so this cost Mika's some love for sure.   The rundown: We won't be back. Mika's has been open several months now, and that seems like enough time to have streamlined the issues we experienced. Plus, the food just wasn't that great and the price point wasn't on par for the quality. Sorry Mika's, I'll be going to Athenian Express and treating myself to MBFGR.

For fast casual Middle Eastern food this is a great find. The quality of lefts, which they call souvlaki, was outstanding. The gyros was a decent quality. The salads are fresh although the take on a village salad is idiosyncratic. The ice tea is also quite good. My only qualm was the pita, which was dry and lacked character. We also had a free geekumber appetizer, another idiosyncratic idea, which was ver good. The ambiance is pleasant as are the help. Some of  the music did not go with decor or eating. I guess it was a Pandora mix.  This is on of three stores for this local chain. My guess is we will return to one for a decent affordable meal. Besides they keep the place clean, and that is important when talking fast casual.

WOW. I am sitting here with a full belly, absolutely impressed with the meal I just had. Fresh, flavorful and not too heavy. If I hadn't eaten like a million of the french fries, it would probably pass as healthy.  The owner was really nice and my to-go order was up quickly. It's right next to British Open Pub, so I can see a few post-drink meals happening in my future!   Oh, the hummus was AMAZING. When I saw it I expected it to be a little gritty and bland, but it was anything but. It has a great flavor but not too lemony or garlicy. Can't put my finger on exactly what is so awesome about it, but it is. Actually, even now as I'm as uncomfortably full as I am, I'm thinking about having another bite of it...

All in all a "meh" experience. It wasn't terrible but it certainly wasn't great. Our food was ready for pick up pretty quickly, which was nice, but the portion sizes were incredibly underwhelming. Flavor was good. I won't be going back, as there are several other Greek places in the valley with better flavor and fairer portions.
The small gyro platter with soup is a go-to lunch... hearty and always good.
Clean place and great food. Pricing is reasonable too. I had the gyro and Greek salad. Good stuff!

My chicken souvlaki was excellent, great food, great value! Just picked from the current "yelp" reviews and it was as good as the other reviewers claimed. I also had the hummus which was great as well.

Service was great and friendly. This place was the cleanest restaurant I've ever been to. It looks like they just opened. I see other reviewers posting about the cleanliness, (which I found strange, but now I understand why). The food was great.  We will definitely be back.
So delicious! Fresh grilled chicken and yummy salad! Owner is very attractive too :) should be open on Sundays though!

Nice interior and nice music. However, I was not very impressed with the vegan options. I got the falafel pita and there were like 4 small pieces of tomato and 5 small pieces of onion, and 4 large falafel. I would opt for 3 falafel and lots more veggies.

I stopped in at the recommendation of a friend. Sounded good so I thought I'd give it a try. It must have been somewhere between lunch and dinner when I got there as the place was barren. Clean, not too large, and I was greeted as I walked in the door. High marks for that. The menus are high tech and on digital TV screens above your head. The cashier / owner gave me a moment to figure out what I wanted. Not being too hungry, I chose a Greek salad and some Greek fries. Both were delicious! Ordering to-go or to stay I made the assumption it would all be packaged the same, but I was wrong. Since I dine in, my food was brought to my table on China with metal silverware. It was unexpected and quite nice. I'm definitely going to go back for something more meaty. I highly recommend you do the same! Enjoy!

Got a Gyro and Greek Fries! Both very good! Place is very clean people working friendly. Was stopping at the Jimmy Johns next door seen this place decided to try it. Glad I did! Greek fries were awesome! Just the right amount of feta and dressing, fries still had a crunch to them!

Excellent service,  great prices and my food was delicious.  I had a gyro with a Greek salad everything was very flavorful and fresh. I also had an order of hummus, regular and jalapeño.... they were both very good, although they don't give enough pita for how much hummus you get. Buy a couple extra.  I'll be back for sure.
I've going to the Scottsdale location for quite some time, I was in the area and was an easy decision to stop at my favorite Greek spot for lunch!
I'll keep it short and simple: food is GREAT, cool ambiance, and they have a Coke Freestyle soda machine to top it off!

Got a large meal two sides: Falafel and Gyro. Didn't get the gyro meat in my delivery so I can't say anything about it, but the falafel was extremely dry. Tasted like it was frozen and not freshly made. The fries were plain fries so don't waste your time on the upgrade because it's $1.25 to get them. The salad was very small and the lettuce was not fresh. Tzatziki sauce tastes bland..no flavor, missing garlic. If I had to do it again I'd pass. There's better food out there especially if you are ordering online paying for an up charge.
Excellent Greek food. Service was great and fast. The flavors were full and bold. I had a small platter with gyro meat and side Greek salad. My friend had the Diablo gyro. I will def. return.

When I first walked in I immediately noticed how clean the place was. Its obvious they take pride in their restaurant. Then the service was great, then the food came out in only a few mins, then the food was delicious. So I'll definitely be back. Thank you!

CLEAN, GREAT GREEK FOOD.  Why am I shouting?  Mika's is that modern and clean.  Did I mention the great gryros!  The meat was moist.  Fresh pita bread and fries.  There are other good gyros in the valley but this tops them
Love this place! Love the staff, the pitas, the lentil soup, Greek salad, Greek fries!

Dewd! This place is THEEBOMB.com. Reasonably priced and the food is fresh and tasty, clean and efficient service. Pretty sure they know what they're doing. Whether you like Greek food or not, you must try it.
Delicious food! I had the Chicken Souvlaki and split the Mika's fries and they were both delicious. I will definitely be back.
Love the food here, this is our go to place  for lunch or fast take out dinner. Do not get this place confused with Georges on McKellips  and Miller with failing health inspections.

I was looking for a quick bite to eat for lunch with vegetarian options near Barrow Neurological Institute. Found Mika's Greek on Yelp, which had good reviews.  I got the Greekpeño Pita with falafel and a side of soup. Really tasty quick and cheap Mediterranean food!  My falafel Pita came out in 5 minutes and was delicious! The falafels were perfect! Crunchy on the outside, soft and flavorful and even a bit spicy on the inside.  My lentil soup was piping hot and very tasty. Exactly what I was craving and perfect to wash down the Pita.  I chose to get takeout, but the restaurant itself looked very inviting and was pretty full around lunchtime.  Would definitely recommend!
Great food. Clean establishment and the portions are good size. I will definitely try this joint again, and try something new.

Best Greek in the area, definitely number one spot for me! I typically go for the Greekpeño pita with falafel usually a salad to go with, but sometimes those fries are too tempting to pass up. Always with      a side of tzatziki. The Falafel is perfect, not dry at all and with lots of flavor. Boyfriend  gets a Mediterranean pita with gyro meat. (Huge plus, they slice their meat here). They offer classic cola and sprite glass bottles. A favorite option :) the guys at the counter are so nice and helpful. The interior is comfy, modern, and clean. Great lunch spot! The consistent deliciousness keeps us coming back for more!!
Hands down the best Greek in town! Quick service, always great food whether you dine-in or take-out, clean and modern atmosphere. One of my favorites! The Scottsdale location is amazing too!

I live around the corner from Mikas and have enjoyed dining there probably over 20 times.  The other day i went there for dinner as usuall and for some reason the gyro meat was extremely salty.  I went and asked for a tziki sauce to calm down my gyro, and was told that they cost 82 cents.  I reluctantly handed over my card, and was quickly told that they cannot accept card under 1 dollar.  I told the young lady i do not have any cash, and she basically said i was sol.  I could buy 2 for my half of a gyro i had left.  This was the worst customer service i have seen in awhile and after being a long time customer it was like a slap in the face.  I know 82 cents but that goes both ways.  I will not be going back!

I am so happy I got a chance to stop by here during my short time in Phoenix. I was able to get some lunch here during work and ordered a pita with their grilled beef. So delicious! I ended up getting the spicier one as well with jalapeños and was quite surprised on how much of a kick it had. Their white sauce was delicious. They're also really reasonable and would definitely recommend for lunch or getting a Greek fix!

Used the reliable GrubHub to have Mika's Greek gyro and greek fries delivered to my hotel nearby.  The BEST gyro with extra gyro beef - I ordered the one with jalepenos and really wanted them to be grilled with grilled green peppers and onions but instead all of the veggies were raw. It was still amazing and since I wasn't specific on my order I couldn't hold it against them.  The fries were barely cooked but the feta and seasoning on top were delish.
Right around the corner from where I work. Food is delicious, and comes out pretty quickly. Great place for the lunch hour rush.  Also, always very nice staff, and  very clean.

Ok, just working on training myself on Yelp reviews as I have been using the app for years but not participating, yeah I know shame on me!  Anyways I am jumping all in.  Mikas Greek does have EXCELLENT GYROS, I have the original and it was great, not really greasy, came with a nice side salad.  Because I saw another guy rave about the Mikas fries I went for it it I kept the blue cheese and wish I didn't, to over the top and really makes it to strong, besides that I thought they were ok.   I was charged .75 for taiki sauce which was kind of bogus should be included.  Staff was great and very clean place- this place is a go
It's pretty good. The seating//dining area could use a little enhancement but the food is about right for the price. Good falafel!

Today I visited mikas Greek and the area was very clear the service was very very good the food was very amazing good quality and good price. In my opinion I recommend this restaurant to everyone. Thanks for everything, Daniel..!!

Food was good and ready when asked for. We called our order in and were pleased with the prompt availability. I gotta say that what we paid for our meal though, I was a little underwhelmed. The salad was fresh and crisp, the appetizers were good, and the gyro was tasty. But nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary to warrant the cost. I may try this place again just to be sure ...

I tried this place for the first time a week ago and I was really impressed. Everything was really fresh. I had the Gyro plate with rice. You can tell that they do really care about there customers. I can tell it was really clean and new. This place was built off tradition. Great place to stop into you want to get something fresh and quick.

Nicholas Greek restaurant has a  rather hip vibe to it. Very pleasant to be in. Staff was courteous and accommodating. We ordered gyros, domaldes,  souvlaki, Greek salad, lentil soup, and Greek chicken.  The good: gyros and Greek salads were tasty. To be improved: The chicken was a bit dry. The souvlaki was overlooked, uninspired hamburger. The domaldes (stuffed grape leaves) were small and vegetarian without taste. The lentil soup was hot but low on flavor.  To get to the next level, Mika's should retain the services of somebody's Greek mother! Jim-The Critic

This is my year of Small Businesses and Mom and Pops.  And wowzah!  I am so happy I've decided to seek out businesses with fewer than 50 reviews to give my business.   Here I am strolling Yelp and this gem pops up.  I order a Tabouli salad (add lamb) and a side of the Greek fries.  I am a goof ball.  I try saying a few of the words I learned in Greece, but the cashier wasn't from Greece, so we had a good laugh at my expense.  So, on to the food.... They gave me a tabouli salad with lamb.... And no knife.  Hmm...  I think to myself.... "Oh no, I should have asked it it was "ground lamb"...."  Boy I was in for a surprise.  I was treated to the most deliciously seasoned tender chunks of lamb.  No Fork Required!  Each savory bite of the chunks of lamb were mouth-wateringly delicious.  The Greek fries with feta and parsley with tzatziki sauce were crispy, hot and fantastic too.  I must come back to try their moussaka!  Return Factor: 80%
